And because the longer we stay here the more people'll question how a fisherman with no engineering background managed to build a sophisticated talking fish robot. Lois: Honey, I'm really sorry for how I acted. Getting so drunk, and ditching you at the bar and letting those boys take pictures of you while you were sleeping. I was so busy having fun, I guess I kind of ruined it for you. [Car honking] Lois: Uh-oh, we got company. Meg: Looks like your fans are back, Mom. Cool kids: Meg! Meg! Meg! Meg! Lois: No, I think this one's all yours. [Cheering] Cool girl: You go, girl! Cool boy 1: All right! Cool boy 2: One's an innie, and one's an outie. Announcer: And now, back to Daggermouth and Boom Boom on Nickelodeon. Daggermouth: Boom Boom, did you do your exercises today? Boom Boom: Yes. I did 20 laps. And I'm about to do 20 more! Daggermouth: Oh, you! Boom Boom: Yipes! [Whimsical instrumental music] Lois: Oh, Peter, I'm so glad being a fisherman is working out for you. You know I gotta admit I half expected to come home, and all our stuff would be gone, and we'd owe somebody a whole lot of money. Peter: How can you "half expect" something? Lois: I don't know. It's just a turn of phrase. Peter: How do you "turn a phrase"? Lois: God, you're dumb! Thank God for that ass! Now, come here and kiss me. Good night, honey. Peter: Good night, Lois. Good night, Jim and Abby. Jim & Abby: Good night. [Abby blowing raspberries] Peter: [laughing] Not now, Abby. [closing theme music]

name: Diane Simmons
line: Good evening. I'm Diane Simmons. A stunning development tonight, as O.J. Simpson is proven innocent. We have the identity of the real killer. But first...

name: Tom Tucker
line: It's fall! The time of year when the leaves turn that pretty, purpley-orange and Quahog prepares for its annual Harvest Festival Parade.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Asian reporter Tricia Takanawa joins us live from the ceremony where they're choosing this year's theme.

name: Tricia Takanawa
line: Diane, behind me are 1,000 beautiful doves. Gently tied to each of their delicate legs is a parade theme suggested by ordinary citizens of Quahog. And here to pick this year's winning theme is "Ten Commandments" star, Charlton Heston.

name: Charlton Heston
line: Let my pigeons go!

name: Tricia Takanawa
line: He nailed one! We have our theme!

name: Cleveland
line: I submitted "togetherness." A simple theme. But powerful, nonetheless.

name: Joe
line: Come on, "overcoming adversity"! Let's go, "overcoming adversity"!

name: Quagmire
line: Show me "women I gave the clap to"! Oh!

name: Charlton Heston
line: And the Harvest Festival Parade theme is: "The episode of 'Who's the Boss?' where Tony sees Angela naked in the shower."

name: Peter
line: Yes! That's mine! Un-freaking-believable! [Cheering]

name: Stewie
line: Oh! Clumsy oaf! Michael Flatley must be turning over in his grave. Wait a minute. He's not dead...yet. "Michael Flatley."

name: Lois
line: Peter, it's great they picked your theme, but isn't it a little esoteric?

name: Peter
line: Esoteric?

name: Peter
line: Lois, "Who's the Boss?" is not a food.

name: Brian
line: Swing and a miss.

name: Meg
line: I have no friends, and it's all because of this stupid purse!

name: Peter
line: What did you do to my daughter? I swear to God, if you touched her-

name: Lois
line: Peter! Honey, what happened?

name: Meg
line: Well, it was lunchtime and...

name: Canner
line: Meg, let me tell you about popularity.

name: Canner
line: Bye!

name: Meg
line: Daddy, if you really loved me, you'd buy me a Prada bag.

name: Peter
line: I can't say no to you, honey. What are they, like, $10?

name: Meg
line: More like $1,100.

name: Peter
line: [Laughing] You wish I loved you that much!

name: Meg
line: [Sighs]

name: Peter
line: We're never gonna get this float done in time for the parade. Pick up the pace, guys!

name: Joe
line: Peter, your theme is a dud.

name: Cleveland
line: Yeah. I've never even seen "Who's the Boss?"

name: Quagmire
line: Tuesdays in the '80s I was always in bed by 8:00...and home by 11:00. Oh!

name: Peter
line: But I can't do it without you guys, because I'll tell you who's the boss. It's not Tony or Angela. It's not even man-crazy Mona. It's all of us. Quagmire, you're the boss because you never give up, like with the ladies.

name: Quagmire
line: Gemini. Augh! Capricorn. Augh! Well, I know you're not a Virgo! Augh!! Hey, from down here, you look like a Pisces! Augh!!!

name: Peter
line: And Cleveland, you're the boss because of your attention to detail. Like when we play pool, you take so long to line up your shots, I just want to crack you with a cue stick. But I don't because that would be a hate crime, and I love you. And Joe, I've had new neighbors before, but none of them were half the man you are. And since you're half a man already, that splits them into some kind of fraction I can't even measure.

name: Joe
line: Peter's right. If we work together, we can win this thing. Who's in?

name: Quagmire
line: Go, Spooner Street!

name: Kevin
line: My dad always says, "Measure twice, cut once."

name: Kevin
line: We didn't measure! We didn't measure!

name: Brian
line: Amazing, Peter, you've inspired the whole neighborhood to work together.

name: Peter
line: You know what's really amazing, Brian? I haven't brushed my teeth in three days, and no one has said a thing.

name: Meg
line: Hey, Stewie, if I had a job, I could buy the bag myself.

name: Stewie
line: Hmmm. I squandered my munitions budget on that insipid Rugrats video! Perhaps I should seek employment. Mother teaches piano; I suppose I could as well.

name: Stewie
line: All right, try it again, Richard. And remember, the wrong keys are electrified.

name: Richard
line: Augh! I don't want to play the piano!

name: Stewie
line: Indeed. Would you rather play the bassoon?

name: Girl
line: [Playing bassoon] [Screams]

name: Flappy
line: No experience? No, thanks.

name: Lois
line: [Sighs]

name: Waitress
line: [Whispering]

name: Flappy
line: Oh, nuts. Young lady! What's the little guy's name?

name: Meg
line: What do you care?

name: Flappy
line: Well, I can't send an unwed teenage mother out on the street without a job.

name: Meg
line: Stewie. My son's name is Stewie.

name: Stewie
line: [spits out cookie]

name: Diane Simmons
line: Welcome to the 83rd annual Quahog Harvest Festival Parade. Are you as excited as I am, Tom?

name: Tom Tucker
line: Are you kidding, Diane? I've got wood...and clipped onto this piece of wood is a list of this year's float entries.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Remember, the float that best captures this year's theme wins Quahog's coveted Golden Clam.

name: Tom Tucker
line: And here's our first float.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Oh, looks like some wires got crossed on Clover Street. That's not Angela. That's Mona, Angela's mom.

name: Tom Tucker
line: Wonderful use of tree bark for the age spots though.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Mmm-hmm.

name: Tom Tucker
line: This one's got Tony bathing Jonathan. Well, that's just plain wrong.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Each float possesses its own unique charm. But none of them-

name: Tom Tucker
line: Oh, baby! Look at that!

name: Joe
line: Peter, the float turned out great.

name: Peter
line: Yeah, our neighborhood hasn't been this united since Quagmire figured out how to get us free cable.

name: Cleveland
line: We are not bad people. We just don't want to pay $12 a month for Cinemax.

name: Diane Simmons
line: First place goes to Spooner Street.

name: All
line: [Cheering] We won! All right! [Uncomfortable laughter]

name: Loretta
line: Come on now! This is damn foolish!

name: Peter
line: My theme, my trophy!

name: Quagmire
line: My aunt Fanny! You said it yourself, Peter! I'm the boss!

name: Cleveland
line: Well, he said I, too, was the boss. And it's time Cleveland got his due.

name: Bonnie
line: Joe, my feet are starting to swell.

name: Joe
line: You two go home. I can stay here as long as it takes. You'd be amazed how little you have to eat when your legs don't work.

name: Peter
line: There's only one way to settle this. Russian Roulette. Three bullets, last guy standing keeps the trophy. Me first. No, no, no, wait a minute, this is crazy. You first.

name: Brian
line: Whoa, whoa, whoa. There's gotta be a way for you all to enjoy the trophy.

name: Peter
line: Wait a minute! I got it! No, lost it. There it is again!

name: Lois
line: Perfect, Peter. Now we can all enjoy it.

name: Cleveland
line: Here's to togetherness!

name: Peter
line: Car. Car! Car!

name: Flappy
line: Meg, order up!

name: Waitress
line: Here you go, hon. From Flappy himself.

name: Stewie
line: I don't care if they're from Kubla filthy-wretched Khan!

name: Waitress
line: Try them. You'll like them.

name: Stewie
line: Yes, well, I rather doubt that. I-oh. Yes! These are delectable. Flappy, good news! I've decided not to kill you!

name: Woman
line: What a precious little boy.

name: Meg
line: Oh, that's my-uh, son.

name: Woman
line: Your son? But you're just a baby yourself. Henry, give the little skank a nice tip.

name: Meg
line: $20! Welcome to Flappy's. Why don't you have a seat next to my little baby whose deadbeat dad doesn't pay child support.

name: Stewie
line: [Belching] Ha!

name: Peter
line: [Horrified scream]

name: Lois
line: Peter, what is it?

name: Cleveland
line: What's going on out here?

name: Joe
line: Clear the way! I'm a cop! Oh, my God! I thought the safety was on. I'm so sorry.

name: Charlton Heston
line: That's okay, son. It's your right as an American citizen. [moaning]

name: Quagmire
line: What's all the noise, boys? I was just jerk-ed out of a sound sleep.

name: Cleveland
line: Perhaps someone could enlighten me as to the whereabouts of our Golden Clam?

name: Quagmire
line: Maybe it fell.

name: Peter
line: Yeah. Right into someone's pocket.

name: Bonnie
line: You think one of us stole it?

name: Peter
line: I never said the word "stole." Looks like someone has a guilty conscience.

name: Joe
line: Guilty conscience! Ha! I'm the only guy on this block who actually pays for his cable.

name: Bonnie
line: Oooh.

name: Cleveland
line: Pretty high and mighty for a man who left our nation's flag out in the rain last Fourth of July. That's against the law, Officer!

name: ALL
line: Oooh.

name: Quagmire
line: You're one to talk. Out there every trash day picking through my garbage. That's an invasion of my privacy.

name: ALL
line: Oooh.

name: Loretta
line: He's sorting your recycling because he loves our Mother Earth. If you weren't so busy trolling for booty all the damned time, you could do it yourself, like the law says you should.

name: ALL
line: Oooh.

name: Peter
line: Oh, it's on now!

name: Joe
line: Wait a second! What about Peter? He's the one who wanted the trophy all along!

name: Peter
line: I couldn't have stolen it. Last night I was stealing Joe's ladder so I could steal the trophy tonight.

name: Lois
line: Peter!

name: Peter
line: What? It's a ladder. He can't use it. It's like taking a watch off a dead guy.

name: Bonnie
line: Those Griffins always were oddballs, Joe. Real oddballs. I don't trust them.

name: Lois
line: I saw them taking coupons out of our mailbox.

name: Quagmire
line: I don't like the look of her!

name: Rod Serling
line: I offer you a recipe. Combine one part small-town neighborhood with a dash of missing trophy and what you're left with is a gumbo fit only for a madman. A gumbo served almost exclusively in The Twi-

name: Peter
line: Who the hell is that? I bet he took it!

name: Joe
line: Where are you going, Serling? Want some of this?

name: Quagmire
line: Come back here!

name: Meg
line: Well, I'm off to work.

name: Peter
line: Okay, honey. One of our neighbors took that trophy, Lois, and I'm gonna find out who.

name: Meg
line: I'm taking Stewie with me again.

name: Lois
line: Fine, sweetie. This whole thing just makes me sick!

name: Peter
line: For crying out loud, we played Pictionary with them!

name: Lois
line: Bastards!

name: Stewie
line: Giddy-up, you stubby little mare! To the pancake house! Hiya!

name: Meg
line: Well, bye.

name: Lois
line: And to think they used to be our best friends!

name: Peter
line: That was then and this is now! And this is a chair. And that's a lamp. And you have boobies. And I'm gonna find that trophy!

name: Joe
line: Well, to be honest, Peter, we were all a little surprised you invited us over.

name: Peter
line: Well, we realized our friendship is a lot more important than some stupid trophy.

name: Peter
line: Oh, there's the tea. I'll get it, Lois. Two sugars, right, Bonnie? [forced laughter]

name: Peter
line: Damn, it's not here!

name: Peter
line: Not here either.

name: Peter
line: Huh. Nothing.

name: Lois
line: Oh, my God! We were robbed!

name: Peter
line: Is anything missing?

name: Lois
line: No. I don't think so. Hey, where's that picture of me in my two-piece at the Cape?

name: Chris
line: Should I call the cops?

name: Peter
line: No, I'm guessing a cop may have had something to do with this. Or a pilot. Or a deli owner. Okay, you dirtbags! This means war!

name: Lois
line: Excuse us. We're having a small problem with home security.

name: Peter
line: Do you guys have those round metal things that you bury in the ground and, when stepped on, they explode?

name: Clerk
line: Land mines?

name: Lois
line: Land mines.

name: Peter
line: It was land mines.

name: Peter
line: Quagmire.

name: Quagmire
line: Peter.

name: Joe
line: Cleveland.

name: Cleveland
line: Joe.

name: Lois
line: Bonnie.

name: Bonnie
line: Lois.

name: Quagmire
line: Cleveland.

name: Joe
line: Lois.

name: Cleveland
line: Bonnie.

name: Lois
line: Quagmire.

name: Bonnie
line: Peter.

name: Loretta
line: [Clears throat]

name: Cleveland
line: Loretta.

name: Lois
line: Come on, Peter.

name: Peter
line: That ought to slow them down.

name: Meg
line: Being a single mother is hard. But the real challenge is having a baby that's addicted to crack. Right, Stewie?

name: Stewie
line: What's that? Oh, yes. I love crack. I'm absolutely coo-coo for crack!

name: Meg
line: This is the first time he's eaten something other than dog food in three weeks. Well, here's your check. God bless.

name: Waitress
line: Here, honey.

name: Stewie
line: What's this? Blueberries? Oh, my.... Oh, that's better than sex!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Oh, and could I get that waitress' address? I'd like to help her baby.

name: Lois
line: What are they up to?

name: Peter
line: Well, Cleveland and Quagmire are holding their positions but I haven't seen Joe all day.

name: Joe
line: Freeze!

name: Kevin
line: Dad?

name: Joe
line: Careful. There's a bear trap two feet to your right.

name: Kevin
line: Thanks, Dad.

name: Joe
line: Look out for your mother!

name: Bonnie
line: There's a sandwich on the counter, honey.

name: Loretta
line: Cleveland, these lobster traps aren't going to catch any intruders.

name: Cleveland
line: Yes, they will. I baited them with these plump and tasty Fenway franks.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Hello.

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, get the hell off my...well, hello, lips, legs, breasts, and ass.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Yes. I was hoping I could ask you about your neighbors, the Griffins.

name: Quagmire
line: The Griffins! A bunch of card-carrying Commies if you ask me! All right. No! No, no! It's not all right!

name: Cleveland
line: The Griffins are not to be trusted.

name: Loretta
line: Mmm-mmm.

name: Joe
line: Those people are nothing but vile, cheating, lying scum.

name: Bonnie
line: And their carpet and drape scheme...[finger down throat]

name: Stewie
line: No! No, I won't! Get that puree of loathsomeness away from me!

name: Lois
line: But you love mashed turkey and peas.

name: Stewie
line: I'm sorry. What was that? I'm sorry, I didn't quite catch that. Did you just tell me what I love? Hmm? Write this down, you toad-faced frump. I love pancakes!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Hi, little fella. Is Meg Griffin here?

name: Lois
line: No, she's not.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Probably out scoring more rock. Sandy Balfour, Child Services. We're placing this baby in a foster home.

name: Lois
line: What?

name: Stewie
line: For God's sake, feed me!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Let me guess. All out of Puppy Chow? What an awful home for a child!

name: Lois
line: How dare you! This is a wonderful home!

name: Peter
line: Quagmire, you rat bastard! Come near my fence again, and that'll be your head!

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, shut up!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Honey, would you like some pancakes?

name: Stewie
line: Oh, yes! God, yes! Take me!

name: Lois
line: Stewie!

name: Meg
line: Next up is Meg Griffin, sporting her stylishly cool, brand-new...

name: Lois
line: Oh, Meg, a woman from Child Services came and took Stewie! She said we fed him dog food!

name: Meg
line: Dog food, huh?

name: Lois
line: Meg, is that a real Prada bag? How in the world did you make $1,100 as a waitress in one week?

name: Meg
line: It's easy...when you're the unwed teenage mother of a crack-addicted baby. [laughing nervously]

name: Peter
line: Wait a minute. Meg, when did you become a teenager?

name: Lois
line: She's 16, Peter.

name: Peter
line: You knew about this?

name: Sarah
line: Welcome to your new foster home. Baby Stewie, say hello to your new brothers and sisters.

name: Hispanic baby
line: Hola, Stewie.

name: Chinese baby
line: Ni hao, Stewie.

name: African baby
line: [click click] Stewie.

name: Stewie
line: Good God! I've been adopted by a Benetton ad!

name: Stevens
line: I promise, it'll never happen again.

name: Clerk
line: I hope not, Mrs. Stevens. Because next time we won't just take him away, we'll kill him. Let's see. Stanley, Starkweather, Stevens!

name: Chris
line: So this is where babies come from?

name: Brian
line: Yes, Chris. This is where babies come from.

name: Chris
line: You told me I came out of your vagina!

name: Clerk
line: Next!

name: Peter
line: Hi. Yeah, we're the Griffins.

name: Clerk
line: Griffin, Griffin...I'm sorry. I can't find your paperwork.

name: Lois
line: Well look harder! I want my baby back!

name: Peter
line: Lois, Lois, please, let me handle this. The name's Griffin. We're the ones who fed dog food to our crack-addicted baby. Jeez, I never was any good at dealing with the authorities.

name: Peter
line: Don't worry, Brian. I know how to handle this.

name: Cop
line: Sir, are you aware you were going 50 in.... I'm gonna have to ask you to put your shirt down, sir.

name: Peter
line: Ah, crap. I get the one straight cop in Rhode Island.

name: Stewie
line: [screams angrily] Damn it! I want pancakes! You people understand every language except English! Yo quiero pancakes! Donnez-moi pancakes! Click-click-bloody-click pancakes!

name: Sarah
line: Poor little guy. "Pancakes" must be street for "crack." Damn those parents of his.

name: Jack
line: Sarah, forgiveness. Now, Stewie, why don't you go play with the others?

name: Chinese baby
line: Stewie, come complete our rainbow!

name: Stewie
line: I've got a better idea. Let's go play "swallow the stuff under the sink."

name: Lois
line: You lied to them!

name: Peter
line: You told Child Services that we steal lawn mowers and cheat on our taxes and worship some guy named Stan.

name: Bonnie
line: Um, actually, I said Satan. That's a typo.

name: Quagmire
line: We didn't know who that woman was! It's not our fault!

name: Lois
line: No? Then whose fault is it?

name: Brian
line: It's all of yours! You were all working together just fine, but then you won that stupid trophy. You put some shiny hunk of metal before your own friendships.

name: Lois
line: Brian's right. We were so obsessed with that trophy, we lost sight of what was really going on. Well, now we have a real problem to deal with.

name: Peter
line: That's right! Somebody tipped off the cable company about our free Cinemax. Joe? ...And we have to get Stewie back! I remembered.

name: Cleveland
line: Well, we're here to help. And we must get our baby back.

name: Joe
line: Right on! Let's do it! Rock their world! Rock their world!

name: ALL
line: Yeah! Come on! Let's go! We can do it!

name: Sarah
line: See kids? One day the world is going to be just like our home. All races living together in harmony and love.

name: Stewie
line: Pancakes!

name: Sarah
line: He must still be working the junk out of his system. He needs hugs!

name: Stewie
line: Doorbell! Doorbell!

name: Cleveland
line: Hi. We're from the One World, One People Book-of-the-Month Club. Is there something missing in yourlife?

name: Jack
line: You know, I just bet there is. Sarah, we have guests! And one of them is a homosexual!

name: Bonnie
line: They're in place! God, it gets me hot when Joe lies to strangers. When I get him home, I swear to God I'm gonna grease up...

name: Lois
line: That's fine, Debbie. Go, Chris.

name: Chris
line: Here we go, Dad!

name: Indian baby
line: Stewie, would you like to learn how to wrap a turban?

name: Stewie
line: Why don't you teach it to the Chinese girl? Or perhaps she can learn after her people invade your country.

name: Indian baby
line: Yee, would your people really do this?

name: Stewie
line: Oh, try and stop them. And try and stop Pablo's people from using drug money to buy arms from Li's countrymen, who will in turn sell them to Ura's people so they can ethnically cleanse the rest of this nauseatingly diverse grab bag of genetic party favors you call a family. So now you all understand, yes? You all hate each other?

name: All
line: [Crying]

name: Stewie
line: Oh, hosanna! It's the lesser of two evils.

name: Peter
line: Oh, hey, kids. I'm Santa Claus. Just practicing for Christmas.

name: Indian baby
line: But you're white. Jack and Sarah told me Santa is Indian.

name: African baby
line: Don't be stupid! Santa is black!

name: Indian baby
line: Santa can't be black. We do not fear him.

name: Chinese baby
line: Cram it, Gandhi! Santa is Asian.

name: Hispanic baby
line: How can he be Asian? Santa doesn't drive his sled 20 miles under the speed limit with his blinker on! Go back to your rice paddy, Mulan!

name: Peter
line: Come on, Stewie. We're out of here.

name: Stewie
line: Dance, puppets! Dance!

name: Peter
line: Lois, we got him. It's all over.

name: Lois
line: Careful, Peter. Joe and Cleveland can't stall them anymore. They're heading your way!

name: Peter
line: Oh, crap!

name: Jack
line: Hold it right there!

name: Peter
line: Or what?

name: Stewie
line: Don't shoot! Now shoot!

name: Lois
line: So, we're terribly sorry we broke into your home. But we just had to get Stewie back somehow.

name: Sarah
line: Well, that's a very long story. But we've grown attached to little Stewie. Plus, the law's on our side.

name: Peter
line: Oh, you people can kiss the fattest part of my ass! We'll be back, Stewie.

name: Sarah
line: Wait!

name: Jack
line: Is that a real Prada bag?

name: Peter
line: I'd like to propose a toast: to our neighbors! Sure they may be black, handicapped, and a heartless sex hound, but hey-if they moved out, some smelly Hawaiians might move in.

name: Joe
line: Hear, hear!

name: Cleveland
line: Hey, where's Quagmire?

name: Lois
line: Yes, if it wasn't for him, we never would have found out where Stewie's foster family lived.

name: Peter
line: He said he'd distract that social worker.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Glen, honey, I have a question for you. What do you do for a living?

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, I have a question for you, too. Why are you still here?

name: Joe
line: What the heck happened to that trophy anyway?

name: Brian
line: I guess some mysteries are better left unsolved.

name: All
line: [Chattering]

name: Brian
line: [moaning]

name: Rod Serling
line: Submitted for your approval. A family pet with the uncontrollable urge to bury shiny objects in the yard. A shameful secret that nearly buried the peace and civility of an entire neighbor...

name: Lois
line: Stewie seems a little feverish after his ordeal. And he keeps asking for pancakes. Let's just let him rest.

name: Stewie
line: Oh! Flappy, what have you done to me? It's so hot. Now I'm freezing! Oh, what I wouldn't do for one syrup-soaked bite. [Screams]

name: Diane Simmons
line: Good evening. I'm Diane Simmons. A stunning development tonight, as O.J. Simpson is proven innocent. We have the identity of the real killer. But first...

name: Tom Tucker
line: It's fall! The time of year when the leaves turn that pretty, purpley-orange and Quahog prepares for its annual Harvest Festival Parade.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Asian reporter Tricia Takanawa joins us live from the ceremony where they're choosing this year's theme.

name: Tricia Takanawa
line: Diane, behind me are 1,000 beautiful doves. Gently tied to each of their delicate legs is a parade theme suggested by ordinary citizens of Quahog. And here to pick this year's winning theme is "Ten Commandments" star, Charlton Heston.

name: Charlton Heston
line: Let my pigeons go!

name: Tricia Takanawa
line: He nailed one! We have our theme!

name: Cleveland
line: I submitted "togetherness." A simple theme. But powerful, nonetheless.

name: Joe
line: Come on, "overcoming adversity"! Let's go, "overcoming adversity"!

name: Quagmire
line: Show me "women I gave the clap to"! Oh!

name: Charlton Heston
line: And the Harvest Festival Parade theme is: "The episode of 'Who's the Boss?' where Tony sees Angela naked in the shower."

name: Peter
line: Yes! That's mine! Un-freaking-believable! [Cheering]

name: Stewie
line: Oh! Clumsy oaf! Michael Flatley must be turning over in his grave. Wait a minute. He's not dead...yet. "Michael Flatley."

name: Lois
line: Peter, it's great they picked your theme, but isn't it a little esoteric?

name: Peter
line: Esoteric?

name: Peter
line: Lois, "Who's the Boss?" is not a food.

name: Brian
line: Swing and a miss.

name: Meg
line: I have no friends, and it's all because of this stupid purse!

name: Peter
line: What did you do to my daughter? I swear to God, if you touched her-

name: Lois
line: Peter! Honey, what happened?

name: Meg
line: Well, it was lunchtime and...

name: Canner
line: Meg, let me tell you about popularity.

name: Canner
line: Bye!

name: Meg
line: Daddy, if you really loved me, you'd buy me a Prada bag.

name: Peter
line: I can't say no to you, honey. What are they, like, $10?

name: Meg
line: More like $1,100.

name: Peter
line: [Laughing] You wish I loved you that much!

name: Meg
line: [Sighs]

name: Peter
line: We're never gonna get this float done in time for the parade. Pick up the pace, guys!

name: Joe
line: Peter, your theme is a dud.

name: Cleveland
line: Yeah. I've never even seen "Who's the Boss?"

name: Quagmire
line: Tuesdays in the '80s I was always in bed by 8:00...and home by 11:00. Oh!

name: Peter
line: But I can't do it without you guys, because I'll tell you who's the boss. It's not Tony or Angela. It's not even man-crazy Mona. It's all of us. Quagmire, you're the boss because you never give up, like with the ladies.

name: Quagmire
line: Gemini. Augh! Capricorn. Augh! Well, I know you're not a Virgo! Augh!! Hey, from down here, you look like a Pisces! Augh!!!

name: Peter
line: And Cleveland, you're the boss because of your attention to detail. Like when we play pool, you take so long to line up your shots, I just want to crack you with a cue stick. But I don't because that would be a hate crime, and I love you. And Joe, I've had new neighbors before, but none of them were half the man you are. And since you're half a man already, that splits them into some kind of fraction I can't even measure.

name: Joe
line: Peter's right. If we work together, we can win this thing. Who's in?

name: Quagmire
line: Go, Spooner Street!

name: Kevin
line: My dad always says, "Measure twice, cut once."

name: Kevin
line: We didn't measure! We didn't measure!

name: Brian
line: Amazing, Peter, you've inspired the whole neighborhood to work together.

name: Peter
line: You know what's really amazing, Brian? I haven't brushed my teeth in three days, and no one has said a thing.

name: Meg
line: Hey, Stewie, if I had a job, I could buy the bag myself.

name: Stewie
line: Hmmm. I squandered my munitions budget on that insipid Rugrats video! Perhaps I should seek employment. Mother teaches piano; I suppose I could as well.

name: Stewie
line: All right, try it again, Richard. And remember, the wrong keys are electrified.

name: Richard
line: Augh! I don't want to play the piano!

name: Stewie
line: Indeed. Would you rather play the bassoon?

name: Girl
line: [Playing bassoon] [Screams]

name: Flappy
line: No experience? No, thanks.

name: Lois
line: [Sighs]

name: Waitress
line: [Whispering]

name: Flappy
line: Oh, nuts. Young lady! What's the little guy's name?

name: Meg
line: What do you care?

name: Flappy
line: Well, I can't send an unwed teenage mother out on the street without a job.

name: Meg
line: Stewie. My son's name is Stewie.

name: Stewie
line: [spits out cookie]

name: Diane Simmons
line: Welcome to the 83rd annual Quahog Harvest Festival Parade. Are you as excited as I am, Tom?

name: Tom Tucker
line: Are you kidding, Diane? I've got wood...and clipped onto this piece of wood is a list of this year's float entries.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Remember, the float that best captures this year's theme wins Quahog's coveted Golden Clam.

name: Tom Tucker
line: And here's our first float.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Oh, looks like some wires got crossed on Clover Street. That's not Angela. That's Mona, Angela's mom.

name: Tom Tucker
line: Wonderful use of tree bark for the age spots though.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Mmm-hmm.

name: Tom Tucker
line: This one's got Tony bathing Jonathan. Well, that's just plain wrong.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Each float possesses its own unique charm. But none of them-

name: Tom Tucker
line: Oh, baby! Look at that!

name: Joe
line: Peter, the float turned out great.

name: Peter
line: Yeah, our neighborhood hasn't been this united since Quagmire figured out how to get us free cable.

name: Cleveland
line: We are not bad people. We just don't want to pay $12 a month for Cinemax.

name: Diane Simmons
line: First place goes to Spooner Street.

name: All
line: [Cheering] We won! All right! [Uncomfortable laughter]

name: Loretta
line: Come on now! This is damn foolish!

name: Peter
line: My theme, my trophy!

name: Quagmire
line: My aunt Fanny! You said it yourself, Peter! I'm the boss!

name: Cleveland
line: Well, he said I, too, was the boss. And it's time Cleveland got his due.

name: Bonnie
line: Joe, my feet are starting to swell.

name: Joe
line: You two go home. I can stay here as long as it takes. You'd be amazed how little you have to eat when your legs don't work.

name: Peter
line: There's only one way to settle this. Russian Roulette. Three bullets, last guy standing keeps the trophy. Me first. No, no, no, wait a minute, this is crazy. You first.

name: Brian
line: Whoa, whoa, whoa. There's gotta be a way for you all to enjoy the trophy.

name: Peter
line: Wait a minute! I got it! No, lost it. There it is again!

name: Lois
line: Perfect, Peter. Now we can all enjoy it.

name: Cleveland
line: Here's to togetherness!

name: Peter
line: Car. Car! Car!

name: Flappy
line: Meg, order up!

name: Waitress
line: Here you go, hon. From Flappy himself.

name: Stewie
line: I don't care if they're from Kubla filthy-wretched Khan!

name: Waitress
line: Try them. You'll like them.

name: Stewie
line: Yes, well, I rather doubt that. I-oh. Yes! These are delectable. Flappy, good news! I've decided not to kill you!

name: Woman
line: What a precious little boy.

name: Meg
line: Oh, that's my-uh, son.

name: Woman
line: Your son? But you're just a baby yourself. Henry, give the little skank a nice tip.

name: Meg
line: $20! Welcome to Flappy's. Why don't you have a seat next to my little baby whose deadbeat dad doesn't pay child support.

name: Stewie
line: [Belching] Ha!

name: Peter
line: [Horrified scream]

name: Lois
line: Peter, what is it?

name: Cleveland
line: What's going on out here?

name: Joe
line: Clear the way! I'm a cop! Oh, my God! I thought the safety was on. I'm so sorry.

name: Charlton Heston
line: That's okay, son. It's your right as an American citizen. [moaning]

name: Quagmire
line: What's all the noise, boys? I was just jerk-ed out of a sound sleep.

name: Cleveland
line: Perhaps someone could enlighten me as to the whereabouts of our Golden Clam?

name: Quagmire
line: Maybe it fell.

name: Peter
line: Yeah. Right into someone's pocket.

name: Bonnie
line: You think one of us stole it?

name: Peter
line: I never said the word "stole." Looks like someone has a guilty conscience.

name: Joe
line: Guilty conscience! Ha! I'm the only guy on this block who actually pays for his cable.

name: Bonnie
line: Oooh.

name: Cleveland
line: Pretty high and mighty for a man who left our nation's flag out in the rain last Fourth of July. That's against the law, Officer!

name: ALL
line: Oooh.

name: Quagmire
line: You're one to talk. Out there every trash day picking through my garbage. That's an invasion of my privacy.

name: ALL
line: Oooh.

name: Loretta
line: He's sorting your recycling because he loves our Mother Earth. If you weren't so busy trolling for booty all the damned time, you could do it yourself, like the law says you should.

name: ALL
line: Oooh.

name: Peter
line: Oh, it's on now!

name: Joe
line: Wait a second! What about Peter? He's the one who wanted the trophy all along!

name: Peter
line: I couldn't have stolen it. Last night I was stealing Joe's ladder so I could steal the trophy tonight.

name: Lois
line: Peter!

name: Peter
line: What? It's a ladder. He can't use it. It's like taking a watch off a dead guy.

name: Bonnie
line: Those Griffins always were oddballs, Joe. Real oddballs. I don't trust them.

name: Lois
line: I saw them taking coupons out of our mailbox.

name: Quagmire
line: I don't like the look of her!

name: Rod Serling
line: I offer you a recipe. Combine one part small-town neighborhood with a dash of missing trophy and what you're left with is a gumbo fit only for a madman. A gumbo served almost exclusively in The Twi-

name: Peter
line: Who the hell is that? I bet he took it!

name: Joe
line: Where are you going, Serling? Want some of this?

name: Quagmire
line: Come back here!

name: Meg
line: Well, I'm off to work.

name: Peter
line: Okay, honey. One of our neighbors took that trophy, Lois, and I'm gonna find out who.

name: Meg
line: I'm taking Stewie with me again.

name: Lois
line: Fine, sweetie. This whole thing just makes me sick!

name: Peter
line: For crying out loud, we played Pictionary with them!

name: Lois
line: Bastards!

name: Stewie
line: Giddy-up, you stubby little mare! To the pancake house! Hiya!

name: Meg
line: Well, bye.

name: Lois
line: And to think they used to be our best friends!

name: Peter
line: That was then and this is now! And this is a chair. And that's a lamp. And you have boobies. And I'm gonna find that trophy!

name: Joe
line: Well, to be honest, Peter, we were all a little surprised you invited us over.

name: Peter
line: Well, we realized our friendship is a lot more important than some stupid trophy.

name: Peter
line: Oh, there's the tea. I'll get it, Lois. Two sugars, right, Bonnie? [forced laughter]

name: Peter
line: Damn, it's not here!

name: Peter
line: Not here either.

name: Peter
line: Huh. Nothing.

name: Lois
line: Oh, my God! We were robbed!

name: Peter
line: Is anything missing?

name: Lois
line: No. I don't think so. Hey, where's that picture of me in my two-piece at the Cape?

name: Chris
line: Should I call the cops?

name: Peter
line: No, I'm guessing a cop may have had something to do with this. Or a pilot. Or a deli owner. Okay, you dirtbags! This means war!

name: Lois
line: Excuse us. We're having a small problem with home security.

name: Peter
line: Do you guys have those round metal things that you bury in the ground and, when stepped on, they explode?

name: Clerk
line: Land mines?

name: Lois
line: Land mines.

name: Peter
line: It was land mines.

name: Peter
line: Quagmire.

name: Quagmire
line: Peter.

name: Joe
line: Cleveland.

name: Cleveland
line: Joe.

name: Lois
line: Bonnie.

name: Bonnie
line: Lois.

name: Quagmire
line: Cleveland.

name: Joe
line: Lois.

name: Cleveland
line: Bonnie.

name: Lois
line: Quagmire.

name: Bonnie
line: Peter.

name: Loretta
line: [Clears throat]

name: Cleveland
line: Loretta.

name: Lois
line: Come on, Peter.

name: Peter
line: That ought to slow them down.

name: Meg
line: Being a single mother is hard. But the real challenge is having a baby that's addicted to crack. Right, Stewie?

name: Stewie
line: What's that? Oh, yes. I love crack. I'm absolutely coo-coo for crack!

name: Meg
line: This is the first time he's eaten something other than dog food in three weeks. Well, here's your check. God bless.

name: Waitress
line: Here, honey.

name: Stewie
line: What's this? Blueberries? Oh, my.... Oh, that's better than sex!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Oh, and could I get that waitress' address? I'd like to help her baby.

name: Lois
line: What are they up to?

name: Peter
line: Well, Cleveland and Quagmire are holding their positions but I haven't seen Joe all day.

name: Joe
line: Freeze!

name: Kevin
line: Dad?

name: Joe
line: Careful. There's a bear trap two feet to your right.

name: Kevin
line: Thanks, Dad.

name: Joe
line: Look out for your mother!

name: Bonnie
line: There's a sandwich on the counter, honey.

name: Loretta
line: Cleveland, these lobster traps aren't going to catch any intruders.

name: Cleveland
line: Yes, they will. I baited them with these plump and tasty Fenway franks.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Hello.

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, get the hell off my...well, hello, lips, legs, breasts, and ass.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Yes. I was hoping I could ask you about your neighbors, the Griffins.

name: Quagmire
line: The Griffins! A bunch of card-carrying Commies if you ask me! All right. No! No, no! It's not all right!

name: Cleveland
line: The Griffins are not to be trusted.

name: Loretta
line: Mmm-mmm.

name: Joe
line: Those people are nothing but vile, cheating, lying scum.

name: Bonnie
line: And their carpet and drape scheme...[finger down throat]

name: Stewie
line: No! No, I won't! Get that puree of loathsomeness away from me!

name: Lois
line: But you love mashed turkey and peas.

name: Stewie
line: I'm sorry. What was that? I'm sorry, I didn't quite catch that. Did you just tell me what I love? Hmm? Write this down, you toad-faced frump. I love pancakes!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Hi, little fella. Is Meg Griffin here?

name: Lois
line: No, she's not.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Probably out scoring more rock. Sandy Balfour, Child Services. We're placing this baby in a foster home.

name: Lois
line: What?

name: Stewie
line: For God's sake, feed me!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Let me guess. All out of Puppy Chow? What an awful home for a child!

name: Lois
line: How dare you! This is a wonderful home!

name: Peter
line: Quagmire, you rat bastard! Come near my fence again, and that'll be your head!

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, shut up!

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Honey, would you like some pancakes?

name: Stewie
line: Oh, yes! God, yes! Take me!

name: Lois
line: Stewie!

name: Meg
line: Next up is Meg Griffin, sporting her stylishly cool, brand-new...

name: Lois
line: Oh, Meg, a woman from Child Services came and took Stewie! She said we fed him dog food!

name: Meg
line: Dog food, huh?

name: Lois
line: Meg, is that a real Prada bag? How in the world did you make $1,100 as a waitress in one week?

name: Meg
line: It's easy...when you're the unwed teenage mother of a crack-addicted baby. [laughing nervously]

name: Peter
line: Wait a minute. Meg, when did you become a teenager?

name: Lois
line: She's 16, Peter.

name: Peter
line: You knew about this?

name: Sarah
line: Welcome to your new foster home. Baby Stewie, say hello to your new brothers and sisters.

name: Hispanic baby
line: Hola, Stewie.

name: Chinese baby
line: Ni hao, Stewie.

name: African baby
line: [click click] Stewie.

name: Stewie
line: Good God! I've been adopted by a Benetton ad!

name: Stevens
line: I promise, it'll never happen again.

name: Clerk
line: I hope not, Mrs. Stevens. Because next time we won't just take him away, we'll kill him. Let's see. Stanley, Starkweather, Stevens!

name: Chris
line: So this is where babies come from?

name: Brian
line: Yes, Chris. This is where babies come from.

name: Chris
line: You told me I came out of your vagina!

name: Clerk
line: Next!

name: Peter
line: Hi. Yeah, we're the Griffins.

name: Clerk
line: Griffin, Griffin...I'm sorry. I can't find your paperwork.

name: Lois
line: Well look harder! I want my baby back!

name: Peter
line: Lois, Lois, please, let me handle this. The name's Griffin. We're the ones who fed dog food to our crack-addicted baby. Jeez, I never was any good at dealing with the authorities.

name: Peter
line: Don't worry, Brian. I know how to handle this.

name: Cop
line: Sir, are you aware you were going 50 in.... I'm gonna have to ask you to put your shirt down, sir.

name: Peter
line: Ah, crap. I get the one straight cop in Rhode Island.

name: Stewie
line: [screams angrily] Damn it! I want pancakes! You people understand every language except English! Yo quiero pancakes! Donnez-moi pancakes! Click-click-bloody-click pancakes!

name: Sarah
line: Poor little guy. "Pancakes" must be street for "crack." Damn those parents of his.

name: Jack
line: Sarah, forgiveness. Now, Stewie, why don't you go play with the others?

name: Chinese baby
line: Stewie, come complete our rainbow!

name: Stewie
line: I've got a better idea. Let's go play "swallow the stuff under the sink."

name: Lois
line: You lied to them!

name: Peter
line: You told Child Services that we steal lawn mowers and cheat on our taxes and worship some guy named Stan.

name: Bonnie
line: Um, actually, I said Satan. That's a typo.

name: Quagmire
line: We didn't know who that woman was! It's not our fault!

name: Lois
line: No? Then whose fault is it?

name: Brian
line: It's all of yours! You were all working together just fine, but then you won that stupid trophy. You put some shiny hunk of metal before your own friendships.

name: Lois
line: Brian's right. We were so obsessed with that trophy, we lost sight of what was really going on. Well, now we have a real problem to deal with.

name: Peter
line: That's right! Somebody tipped off the cable company about our free Cinemax. Joe? ...And we have to get Stewie back! I remembered.

name: Cleveland
line: Well, we're here to help. And we must get our baby back.

name: Joe
line: Right on! Let's do it! Rock their world! Rock their world!

name: ALL
line: Yeah! Come on! Let's go! We can do it!

name: Sarah
line: See kids? One day the world is going to be just like our home. All races living together in harmony and love.

name: Stewie
line: Pancakes!

name: Sarah
line: He must still be working the junk out of his system. He needs hugs!

name: Stewie
line: Doorbell! Doorbell!

name: Cleveland
line: Hi. We're from the One World, One People Book-of-the-Month Club. Is there something missing in yourlife?

name: Jack
line: You know, I just bet there is. Sarah, we have guests! And one of them is a homosexual!

name: Bonnie
line: They're in place! God, it gets me hot when Joe lies to strangers. When I get him home, I swear to God I'm gonna grease up...

name: Lois
line: That's fine, Debbie. Go, Chris.

name: Chris
line: Here we go, Dad!

name: Indian baby
line: Stewie, would you like to learn how to wrap a turban?

name: Stewie
line: Why don't you teach it to the Chinese girl? Or perhaps she can learn after her people invade your country.

name: Indian baby
line: Yee, would your people really do this?

name: Stewie
line: Oh, try and stop them. And try and stop Pablo's people from using drug money to buy arms from Li's countrymen, who will in turn sell them to Ura's people so they can ethnically cleanse the rest of this nauseatingly diverse grab bag of genetic party favors you call a family. So now you all understand, yes? You all hate each other?

name: All
line: [Crying]

name: Stewie
line: Oh, hosanna! It's the lesser of two evils.

name: Peter
line: Oh, hey, kids. I'm Santa Claus. Just practicing for Christmas.

name: Indian baby
line: But you're white. Jack and Sarah told me Santa is Indian.

name: African baby
line: Don't be stupid! Santa is black!

name: Indian baby
line: Santa can't be black. We do not fear him.

name: Chinese baby
line: Cram it, Gandhi! Santa is Asian.

name: Hispanic baby
line: How can he be Asian? Santa doesn't drive his sled 20 miles under the speed limit with his blinker on! Go back to your rice paddy, Mulan!

name: Peter
line: Come on, Stewie. We're out of here.

name: Stewie
line: Dance, puppets! Dance!

name: Peter
line: Lois, we got him. It's all over.

name: Lois
line: Careful, Peter. Joe and Cleveland can't stall them anymore. They're heading your way!

name: Peter
line: Oh, crap!

name: Jack
line: Hold it right there!

name: Peter
line: Or what?

name: Stewie
line: Don't shoot! Now shoot!

name: Lois
line: So, we're terribly sorry we broke into your home. But we just had to get Stewie back somehow.

name: Sarah
line: Well, that's a very long story. But we've grown attached to little Stewie. Plus, the law's on our side.

name: Peter
line: Oh, you people can kiss the fattest part of my ass! We'll be back, Stewie.

name: Sarah
line: Wait!

name: Jack
line: Is that a real Prada bag?

name: Peter
line: I'd like to propose a toast: to our neighbors! Sure they may be black, handicapped, and a heartless sex hound, but hey-if they moved out, some smelly Hawaiians might move in.

name: Joe
line: Hear, hear!

name: Cleveland
line: Hey, where's Quagmire?

name: Lois
line: Yes, if it wasn't for him, we never would have found out where Stewie's foster family lived.

name: Peter
line: He said he'd distract that social worker.

name: Sandy Balfour
line: Glen, honey, I have a question for you. What do you do for a living?

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, I have a question for you, too. Why are you still here?

name: Joe
line: What the heck happened to that trophy anyway?

name: Brian
line: I guess some mysteries are better left unsolved.

name: All
line: [Chattering]

name: Brian
line: [moaning]

name: Rod Serling
line: Submitted for your approval. A family pet with the uncontrollable urge to bury shiny objects in the yard. A shameful secret that nearly buried the peace and civility of an entire neighbor...

name: Lois
line: Stewie seems a little feverish after his ordeal. And he keeps asking for pancakes. Let's just let him rest.

name: Stewie
line: Oh! Flappy, what have you done to me? It's so hot. Now I'm freezing! Oh, what I wouldn't do for one syrup-soaked bite. [Screams]

name: Stewie
line: Oh, Machiavelli! You've told me nothing I don't already know! Ah, Sun Tzu's "The Art of War."

name: Lois
line: Stewie, those books aren't for babies. Here. Watch the Teletubbies.

name: Stewie
line: How dare you! That book may hold the key to my enslaving of all mankind. Ooh, fuzzy.

name: Teletubby
line: [giddy laughter] Tickle.

name: Stewie
line: God, the more I resist, the more intriguing they become! I can't look away!

name: Teletubbies
line: Again! Again!

name: Stewie
line: Yes! Yes! Again! Again! Oh, dear God, please once more!

name: Peter
line: Sorry, Stewie. A&E Biography is doing the life of the other guy from Wham.

name: Stewie
line: I'm free! Free from the spell of those diabolical Teletubbies! Thank you. When the world is mine, your death shall be quick and painless.

name: Weed
line: Attention, please. Tomorrow is softball practice. We have a lot of work to do for Saturday's game. Let's not forget how badly we were humiliated last year by Pawtucket Joke and Novelties.

name: Pawtucket players
line: [Raucous laughter]

name: Peter
line: [Peter giggles] Look at those morons and their stupid glasses.

name: Peter
line: Oh, man. I hate those guys. More than I hate spinach, traffic jams, and the last few years of M* A*S*H. You know, when Alan Alda took over behind the camera and the show got all dramatic and preachy? Huh, am I right? Who's with me?

name: Weed
line: This year we will defeat those Pranksters with our secret weapon: Guillermo.

name: Man
line: [Screaming]

name: Weed
line: Bravo! I hired Guillermo because I believe he will be an asset to our company on and off the field.

name: Weed
line: Back to work, people.

name: Peter
line: Heya, Mr. Weed, I got a great idea for a new line of TV action figures. Facts of Life Transformers, huh? Watch the transformation: cute as a button/fat as a cow/radioactive scorpion. Huh? Watch out, Mrs. Garrett. Here comes Blair!

name: Weed
line: I'll consider it.

name: Peter
line: He'll consider it! Hey, I got another one where Natalie's one of those spittin' lizards from Jurassic Park.

name: Contestant
line: Pat, I would like to solve the puzzle. "Go tuck yourself in."

name: Pat Sajak
line: You got it.

name: Chris
line: Well, you were close, Dad.

name: Peter
line: Yeah. I still can't believe we missed the phrase, "My hairy aunt." Come on, Brian. I gotta get to softball practice.

name: Lois
line: Practice? I thought we were go next door and welcome our new neighbors.

name: Peter
line: Oh, no, no, no. I don't want anything to do with neighbors. Last guy who lived next door borrowed my toaster. Never saw it again.

name: Man
line: If that slut wants full custody of the kids, she's got it.

name: Lois
line: Peter, they might be very nice people.

name: Peter
line: "Very nice people." Yeah, that's what they always say. Then you open up the septic tank and bam! Skeleton city!

name: Brian
line: [Panting]

name: Woman
line: Pervert!

name: Brian
line: Oh, don't flatter yourself, honey. I don't have any sweat glands.

name: Weed
line: Okay, my Happy-Go-Lucky Toy Boys, time for batting practice. Guillermo, you're up. Unfortunately, Johnson isn't here to pitch today. His wife is in labor.

name: Peter
line: Oh, what? Is the baby coming out of him? Jeez, I'll pitch.

name: Brian
line: Ha. I don't know what's more questionable, your pitching arm or Bill Clinton's integrity.

name: Peter
line: Oh, how hard...

name: Peter
line: Oh, how hard can it be to pitch?

name: Peter
line: Okay. Take your base.

name: Weed
line: Somebody call 911. Tell them he is allergic to penicillin and white zinfandel! Idiot! If you don't find a ringer to replace Guillermo, you're fired!

name: Peter
line: Oh, man. What am I gonna do if I get fired? I'll have to go back to my old job as a Calvin Klein model.

name: Guy
line: But I don't want to be different.

name: Peter
line: What was the name of the bad guy from Tron? Ah, this is gonna drive me nuts!

name: Lois
line: Moving is never easy on a family.

name: Bonnie
line: Well, we are gonna miss the go-go-go pace of Providence. But with number two on the way, Joe thought it was time to move. And I can't say no to Joe. Ever.

name: Lois
line: Oh, Quahog can be pretty exciting, too. Last week, someone lost an eye at Bingo.

name: Man
line: I-17. Oh, darn it. [screams]

name: Bonnie
line: Oh, I haven't played Bingo in years!

name: Stewie
line: Silence! Ever since you two met, you've done nothing but wax idiotic! I must escape this infernal babble! Aagh!

name: Bonnie
line: [Chuckles] What a little explorer.

name: Lois
line: Yes. He's so full of wonder.

name: Stewie
line: Oh, to be the Lindbergh baby right about now.

name: Bonnie
line: Joe, you have to meet our new neighbor, Lois Griffin.

name: Joe
line: It's a pleasure, Lois. Who's the little guy?

name: Lois
line: This is Stewie. Honey, say hi to Mr. Swanson.

name: Stewie
line: You will bow to me.

name: Meg
line: Hi. I'm Meg. I live next door.

name: Kevin
line: I know. I've admired you in the garden from afar.

name: Meg
line: Will you go out with me?

name: Kevin
line: I'd love to.

name: Chris
line: Oh, he's gay.

name: Meg
line: You wish! Get out of here, you mouth-breather!

name: Peter
line: I'm as good as fired. Where the hell am I gonna find a guy as strong as Guillermo? One time I walked into the locker room, I swear he was bench-pressing Mr. Weed. Ah, great. Lois is getting chummy with the new neighbors.

name: Brian
line: I think she wants you to meet them.

name: Peter
line: She's always making me be social. Cocktail parties, school functions, that time we planted trees in Jerusalem.

name: Peter
line: What? Look, all I'm saying is put an Israeli guy next to an Arab guy and I can't tell the difference.

name: Joe
line: You must be Peter. Joe Swanson.

name: Peter
line: Yeah, yeah. Nice to meet you, Phil. You know, you got a neighbor on the other side of your house, too. So, you know, don't think you always have to bug me.

name: Joe
line: [laughs] I'll keep that in mind. Say, do you have a screwdriver I can borrow?

name: Peter
line: Man, you neighbors are like viruses. Starts with a screwdriver. Then before you know it, you're using my supermarket, my dry cleaner, and even my postman. Sheesh, can you believe that guy? "Do you have a screwdriver I can borrow?" What an ass.

name: Brian
line: So, Peter, did you find a replacement for the team?

name: Peter
line: No. Believe me, I've been looking.

name: Manager
line: Hideo-san would be honored to play for your team. But he wishes to know what compensation you offer.

name: Peter
line: Uh, me love you long time.

name: Brian
line: Gosh, I'd like to help you, Peter. But I've gotta go out in the hall and chew on the back of my ass for

name: Lois
line: Oh, Peter, I invited Joe and Bonnie to your game on Saturday.

name: Peter
line: Lois, I don't want those people there. See, this is why I ask you to submit everything to me in writing first.

name: Lois
line: Bonnie told me Joe is a big baseball fan. He played in college.

name: Peter
line: He did?

name: Peter
line: Welcome to the neighborhood. Hiya, Joe.

name: Joe
line: Peter!

name: Peter
line: Oh, don't get up.

name: Joe
line: This is a surprise. I kinda thought you didn't like me.

name: Peter
line: Oh, what? Because of what I said this afternoon. Oh, no, no, no. See I have that disease where stuff just pops out of your mouth. Go to hell! Go to hell! Whoops. See what I mean?

name: Joe
line: Oh, I'm so sorry. I thought maybe I crossed the line when I asked to borrow a screwdriver.

name: Peter
line: Are you kidding? You can borrow whatever you want.

name: Joe
line: Great. Say, you don't happen to have any picture wire, do you?

name: Peter
line: Picture wire? You son of a bitch.

name: Peter
line: Son of a bitch! Son of a bitch! There it goes again.

name: Joe
line: I don't want to impose.

name: Peter
line: No problem. That's what neighbors do. You know what else they do? They play on their neighbor's company softball team, like this Saturday. What do you say, neighbor?

name: Joe
line: Sounds fun.

name: Peter
line: So much fun it should be illegal like...copyright infringement. [Mickey Mouse voice] See you at the game, Joe.

name: Pawtucket player
line: Hey, you want a piece of gum?

name: Quahog player
line: Oh, thanks.

name: Pawtucket player
line: Ha-ha! That was joke gum.

name: Quahog player
line: What do you mean?

name: Pawtucket player
line: Now you're addicted to heroin.

name: Quahog player
line: I'm cold.

name: Lois
line: Hey, Peter!

name: Weed
line: It's nice that your family is here, Peter. If your ringer doesn't arrive soon, you can spend every day with them-at home.

name: Peter
line: He'll be here, Mr. Weed. You should see this guy in action. He can hit, he can throw...

name: Joe
line: Peter!

name: Weed
line: What's he doing in a wheelchair?

name: Peter
line: Holy crip, he's a crapple!

name: Weed
line: Peter, our new secret weapon is this very attractive paraplegic?

name: Peter
line: Okay, Joe, you got me. Rise and shine. Come on. Stand and deliver. Get the hell up.

name: Joe
line: Ha, ha, you're a hoot, Peter.

name: Umpire
line: Play ball!

name: Joe
line: Let's do it!

name: Peter
line: I swear I didn't know. Maybe they won't hit a lot of balls to him.

name: Joe
line: I got shortstop.

name: Bonnie
line: The movers tracked grease all over my carpet. I tried everything to get the stain out.

name: Lois
line: What about lemon juice?

name: Bonnie
line: What about club soda?

name: Stewie
line: What about shutting the hell up?

name: Meg
line: Isn't baseball great? [pause] They say baseball's the national pastime. [longer pause] I can't taste salt.

name: Peter
line: Ah, crap! Don't hit it to Joe. Please don't hit it to Joe! Please don't hit it to Joe!

name: Umpire
line: You're out!

name: Peter
line: All right, Joe! Way to earn that parking space!

name: Bonnie
line: All right!

name: Lois
line: Did you see that?

name: Bonnie
line: That's my Joe!

name: Stewie
line: What the deuce? Half man, half machine. Why, with that technology, I could escape these wretched harridans! Go, cyborg!

name: Weed
line: It all rests on that man's broad, rippling shoulders!

name: Weed
line: All right, Joe! Run!

name: Peter
line: All right, Joe! Come on! Yeah!

name: Weed
line: Hurry! Joe! All right! Yes, vamos!

name: Player
line: Let's hear it for Joe!

name: Peter
line: Yeah, let's hear it for the guy who found Joe! Yay. Okay. Huh.

name: Joe
line: That's finger suckin' good, huh? It's an old policemen's recipe. Eat up, everyone. Tonight my wife won't be the only one enjoying a pig in a blanket.

name: Bonnie
line: Joe, you're so funny.

name: Joe
line: They love that one down at the precinct.

name: Peter
line: Ah, this sucks, Brian. Joe is stealing my thunder.

name: Joe
line: Hey, everybody! Time to limbo!

name: Brian
line: Face it. He's the life of the party.

name: Peter
line: Ah, yeah? I'll show you who's the life of the party. Hey, look! Hey! I fell in the pool with my clothes on! How hilarious is that? That is so Peter Griffin. Guys? Huh? Guys?

name: Joe
line: That's my idea.

name: Weed
line: Peter, come here.

name: Peter
line: Oh, finally. A little recognition.

name: Weed
line: Joe has the most wonderful idea.

name: Joe
line: Hey, I just suggested a line of handi-capable toys. You know, to show kids the fun side of being physically challenged!

name: Peter
line: Oh, yeah, that's what kids want to play with. Yeah. A Beanie Baby in a bubble. What about my idea? Come on! Tootie morphs into a stink bug.

name: Weed
line: Joe, you're exactly the kind of man we need at our company. Peter, make yourself useful. Go get Joe a drink.

name: Peter
line: Jeez, first he takes my friends. Then he takes my job. But the way I wear my hat.... No. No. He can't take that away from me.

name: Stewie
line: You! How came you by this metal construct? I demand to know who made you!

name: Lois
line: Stewie, it's not polite to point. I'm so sorry.

name: Joe
line: That's okay, Lois. He's just curious about the chair. About 10 years ago, I was investigating a robbery at an orphanage. It was Christmas Eve and some presents had been stolen.

name: Joe
line: Reach for the sky, dirtbag! All right, pal! You've stolen your last Christmas.

name: The Grinch
line: You think you have won, you think all is well, but kiss my green ass, I shall see you in hell!

name: Joe
line: Are you Timmy? Merry Christmas, Timmy.

name: Stewie
line: Oh, enough! If you won't share your technological schemata with me peaceably, I shall take the information from you by force!

name: Lois
line: Well, looks like you have a fan.

name: Peter
line: Come on. Let's get out of here.

name: Joe
line: Peter, you can't leave.

name: Peter
line: Sorry, I promised the wife and kids I'd take them on a dream vacation to Hawaii, right now. Say aloha, kids.

name: Meg
line: What are you talking about? We want to hear more of Mr. Swanson's stories.

name: Chris
line: He's cool, Dad. He killed a guy.

name: Joe
line: Well, technically, he was killed by the state, but funny story-he did curse my name just before the injection.

name: Lois
line: Peter, what's the matter with you?

name: Peter
line: Why are you guys making such a big deal over Joe? You're not supposed to admire wheelchair people. You're supposed to feel sorry for them. Jeez, when did it become okay to be handicapped?

name: Lois
line: Don't talk like that! He's a remarkable man, and the rest of your family adores him.

name: Peter
line: Well, fine, then why don't you all marry him? And if he's so remarkable, let's see him do this. "Hey, look at me, I'm walking. Ooh, I'm a remarkable man."

name: Peter
line: Well, look who finally came home. Jeez, I thought you were gonna spend all night over at Joe's.

name: Brian
line: I could have. That man has got magic fingers. He found this one spot behind my ear-forget about it. I thought my leg was never gonna stop.

name: Peter
line: I don't believe this. My whole family worships the ground that guy can't walk on.

name: Brian
line: Well, it's not too hard to see why. I mean, the guy's a hero; he makes the world a better place.

name: Peter
line: Hey, hey, hey, I've done lots of things to help people. Remember that time I sang to the kids down at the Sunday school?

name: Brian
line: Yes, and you forgot the words.

name: Peter
line: ? Jesus loves me, he loves me a bunch? ?'Cause he always puts Skippy in my lunch ?

name: Brian
line: No, no, no, it's not the same thing. Joe puts himself in real danger, every day.

name: Peter
line: [sighs] You're right. I'll never be that kind of hero...unless I put myself in real danger, too, for my family's sake!

name: Brian
line: Why are the pretty ones always so dumb?

name: Stewie
line: [Screaming]

name: Dispatch radio
line: We hava a gang shooting on Third and Main. Three wounded, one dead.

name: Brian
line: Is it me, or is rap music just getting lazier?

name: Peter
line: No, no. It's my new police scanner. This hero thing is gonna be easy once I find the right crime.

name: Dispatch radio
line: We have a domestic disturbance...

name: Peter
line: Boring!

name: Dispatch radio
line: Report of a stabbing at...

name: Peter
line: Blah blah blah blah blah.

name: Dispatch radio
line: All units! All units! A major bank robbery is in progress at Quahog Bank and Trust. Suspects are armed and extremely dangerous.

name: Peter
line: Perfect! Where's Lois and the kids?

name: Brian
line: Uh, over at Joe's.

name: Peter
line: Well, go fetch 'em. They're about to see a real hero in action. To the Batcave!

name: Peter
line: Uh-oh.

name: Peter
line: Oh, God! Oh, God! Oh, God!

name: Peter
line: You thought Joe was something. You ain't seen nothin' yet.

name: Lois
line: Peter, what's the big rush?

name: Peter
line: All right, you guys wait right here. Daddy's gonna make a little withdrawal.

name: Girl
line: No, don't go.

name: Peter
line: I hope you brought your striped pajamas, boys. 'cause there's a five-year sleepover at the big house, and you're invited.

name: Peter
line: Oh, Lois and the kids should be in here to see this.

name: Brian
line: Yes. It's going very well.

name: Meg
line: Mom, what do you do when you like a boy but he doesn't even notice you?

name: Chris
line: Meg loves Kevin.

name: Meg
line: Shut up, you big sack of dog vomit!

name: Lois
line: Meg, you're a sweet, lovely girl. He'll come around.

name: Meg
line: Such a mom answer.

name: Lois
line: Well, have you tried showing off the goods? How's that for a mom answer?

name: Meg
line: Creepy.

name: Lois
line: Oh, I saw some cute dresses down the street. If nothing else, it'll make you feel better. Come on, you guys.

name: Brian
line: Well, if you want to be a hero, now might be a good time.

name: Peter
line: Jeez, Brian, this isn't what I was expecting. I thought being a hero would be all fun and games.

name: Peter
line: Sorry, Wonder Woman, I got three kings. Now let's see your pair.

name: Peter
line: Haha, all right. Hey, Robin, what are you looking at me for? Look at her.

name: Peter
line: Don't worry, Brian. I got a plan.

name: Brian
line: Oh, good. I was afraid you were just gonna improvise.

name: Peter
line: Oh. Well, actually, I was gonna use the little girl as a human shield and run like hell. But improvise, that'll be easier on my back.

name: Peter
line: Okay, in this improv, Tammy and the short robber are husband and wife. Okay. And where are we?

name: Old woman
line: Guadalajara, Mexico!

name: Peter
line: Okay, okay. I heard pet store. And I'm the gruff but lovable owner. All right. Begin. Hello, married couple. I see you found a puppy.

name: Peter
line: Well, before you take Sparky home, let me check him for worms. Okay, drop it! All right, you guys. Let's get out of here.

name: Cop
line: All right, stand back!

name: Peter
line: Whoa, whoa. Hang on, hang on. Sorry, no one can leave. Listen, the whole reason I saved you guys today was so I could be a hero. See, this wheelchair guy moved in next door and he can do all these great things and, well...

name: Girl
line: Your family idolizes the lousy cripple and not you?

name: Peter
line: That's right! How'd you know?

name: Old woman
line: We've all been there.

name: Chris
line: Cool! The bank is getting jacked!

name: Lois
line: Officer, my husband's in there! Can you tell me if he's okay?

name: Lois
line: He's wearing a white, collared shirt, kind of big, with glasses.

name: Lois
line: Oh, thank God.

name: Lois
line: No!

name: Peter
line: Hey, there's my family.

name: Peter
line: But...but, I was gonna be a hero.

name: Bonnie
line: Joe, it's Peter! He's in trouble!

name: Tom Tucker
line: A failed robbery at Quahog Bank and Trust has led to a terrifying hostage situation. [pause] That's right. A hostage situation.

name: Joe
line: I gotta go.

name: Bonnie
line: I know.

name: Peter
line: Uh, excuse me. Shouldn't that be "whom"?

name: Peter
line: Crap!

name: Joe
line: This is Police Lieutenant Joe Swanson. I know we can work this out together.

name: Peter
line: Aw, jeez, not him again. I hope this place isn't wheelchair accessible.

name: Lois
line: Bonnie, it's Peter.

name: Bonnie
line: Don't worry. Joe's an excellent negotiator. I was a virgin when we met. It took him three hours.

name: Meg
line: I can't believe my dad is in there. [pause] This'll probably scar me for the rest of my life. [pause] I got a new dress.

name: Meg
line: So do you like music?

name: Kevin
line: Oh, yeah! I played guitar in a band before we moved. But it interfered with my studies. What do you listen to?

name: Meg
line: You first.

name: Kevin
line: I'm into Garbage, Phish, Blur. My parents don't like me listening to that stuff. But I do anyway, because I am not a robot!!! I also like Radiohead.

name: Joe
line: And even though society has turned its back on you, I promise you there are people who care. And you know what? I'm one of them.

name: Peter
line: Oh, come on, guys. Don't let him sweet talk you like that. Wait, wait, wait. You can't leave now. I'm supposed to be the hero here. Wait! Can you let me pistol-whip you a couple times for the camera? Dang, stupid robbers

name: Stewie
line: Aha! Excellent! They detached the human component from the machine. Machine, I am your new master and I order you to go! Engage! Blast! Must be some kind of proprietary command system. Now on the Russian MiG, it's next to the altimeter.

name: Lois
line: There you are. I can't turn my back on you for a second.

name: Stewie
line: Augh! One day I shall unlock the secret of that device. And when I do, Mother, victory shall be...

name: Lois
line: Peter, you had us so worried. What on earth were you trying to prove?

name: Peter
line: I'm sorry. Joe is a great guy. I guess I was just tired of him being your hero.

name: Lois
line: Peter, Joe is a hero, but he's not our hero. You are.

name: Peter
line: Really?

name: Lois
line: Yeah. You're always right there on the couch for us, making us laugh when we're upset. Changing the channel when something boring comes on. Eating the last slice of pizza so the rest of us don't fight over it.

name: Meg
line: Yeah, Daddy. And if you hadn't pulled this stunt I never would have learned how to manipulate Kevin.

name: Chris
line: And when the kids at school see us on TV, they'll think you're a total psycho. And I can say, "That psycho is my dad!"

name: Michelle Kwan
line: And I would never have won the silver in Nagano, if you hadn't driven me to the ice rink every morning at 6:00 a.m.

name: Peter
line: I guess being a hero isn't always about saving lives and catching bad guys. It's also about just being there for the people you love.

name: Old Woman
line: Help! Someone just stole my purse!

name: Peter
line: Who cares? I don't even know you.

name: Theme Song Lois
line: That's funny. I don't remember buying Stewie these toys. Oh, my God! It all makes sense now. My baby is some kind of diabolical genius bent on world domination! Stewie: [slow clapping] Bravo, Lois. The last horse finally crosses the finish line. Lois: Stewie! All these months I should've been paying attention to what you've been saying. You're an evil child. Why? Why did I have to go and smoke pot when I was pregnant with you? Stewie: Cheer up, Mother. You should be proud. You've given birth to the future emperor of the world. Pity you won't be around to enjoy it. Cheerio! Lois: [Screams] Peter: Lois. Lois! What's the matter? Lois: I just had the strangest dream. Something about Stewie and Cheerios. It's gone. Peter: Well, come on, get up. It's opening day for the Sox. Hey, Chris, Meg, we're going to Fenway! Lois: Peter, you can't pull the kids out of school for a baseball game. Peter: Aw, there's nothing these kids learn in school they can't learn on the street. Gang Member: It's 3:00. Where the hell is Louie? Gang Member 2: Well, you tell me. Louie left his house at 2:15 and has to travel a distance of 6.2 miles at a rate of 5 miles per hour. What time will Louie arrive? Gang Member: Depends if he stops to see his ho. Gang Member 2: That's what we call a variable! Chris: Look what I made for the game. [holds up sign reading John 3:16] Meg: What does that mean, anyway? Brian: <reading from Bible> "And the Lord said, 'Go, Sox."' Meg: Dad, don't you have to work today? Peter: It's nothing a little phone call can't take care of. Mr. Weed: Hello? Peter: Mr. Weed? I can't come to work today. I was in a terrible plane crash. My entire family was killed, and I am a vegetable. I'll see you tomorrow. <hangs up> Huh? Huh? Brian: Oh, please, Peter. Your excuses are lamer than FDR's legs. All: [Gasping] Brian: Too soon? Mom: Here it comes, Jeremy! Jeremy: I got it! I got it! Peter: Yes! Yeah! All right! I'm the man! Yeah! Hold on to this, Stewie. It'll be a souvenir of your first major-league game with your dad. Stewie: My God. I shall cherish this forever. I say, Opie, I'll trade you this baseball for your souvenir bat. Boy: Sure! Stewie: What did you learn? Peter: This is great. We haven't done anything together like this since we saw Mike Tyson get beat. [cut to National Spelling Bee] Moderator: The word, again, is "onomatopoeia." Mike Tyson: Uh..."C." Moderator: I'm sorry. That's incorrect. Mike Tyson: Oh, dang! Lois: I'm so glad you talked us all into playing hooky. Peter: Me, too. Hey, maybe we can get on TV if we take our shirts off and run onto the field. Lois: Peter, I'm not taking my shirt off. Peter: [pulls up Lois' shirt] There. Now they're old news. Lois: Peter! Peter: Go, Sox! [tumbles down steps] [Screaming] Hmmm.[Snorting hot dog] [Snorting mustard] Mr. Weed: Peter? Peter: Oh, uh, hi, Mr. Weed. Mr. Weed: Well, tt seems you've made a full recovery. Peter: Oh, yeah. That plane crash I told you about, it turned out to be gas. Mr. Weed: Aha! Liar! Tomorrow, my office, 9:30. Peter: I'm tired of Mr. Weed treating me like a common doormat. I want him to treat me like one of those deluxe one from Pottery Barn with the fancy straw. Brian: I don't care for Pottery Barn. Peter, if you want Mr. Weed to respect you, you're gonna have to earn it. Peter: Hmm, "earn it." [Snorting drink] Mr. Weed: Why have you forsaken me? Peter: Uh, Mr. Weed? I heard you ran into my identical twin brother at the ball game yesterday. And if you don't buy that, I'm sorry I was at the ball game yesterday. Mr. Weed: Peter, I just received terrible news. This company has been taken over by a conglomerate. After 23 years of faithful service, I've been terminated! Peter: Wow, the business world sure is funny. [cut to "Dilbert"] Wally: Hey, Dilbert, what do you call it when a guy in middle management moves all the way to upper management? Dilbert: I don't know. What do you call it? Wally: A promotion. Dilbert: Oh, thanks. Here's a memo. Peter: Well ometimes the business world's funny. Executive: And so, on behalf of the El Dorado Cigarette Company I'd like to welcome you to our family. I think you'll be very happy with the changes we've made. Peter: Aw, this is sweet! Why are you putting a window in the middle of the factory? Construction worker: So Aunt Bee has a place to let her pies cool. Aunt Bee: Hello, boys. Today's pie is cherry. It'll be ready just in time for lunch. Peter: Wow, these guys sure know how to run a company. Executive: Look how happy those morons are. They'll never realize we're using those toys to get children addicted to our company's cigarettes. All: [Laughing maniacally] Executive: [Whistles] Good boy, Connor. Pull. All: [Laughing maniacally] Chris: Can't we eat? I'm so hungry I could ride a horse. I don't get it. Well, I could ride it to the store, I guess. Lois: I told you we're not starting without your father. Dinner just isn't dinner without him. Stewie: Well, perhaps I could help simulate the experience. [throws face into food] [makes ridiculous noises] Peter: Hey, family. Anyone in the mood for lobste-oh, God! One of them has my pupil! [Screaming] Brian: Peter, how the hell can you afford lobster on your salary? Peter: I got a raise. Brian: What? Peter: Yeah. The new owners gave everyone raises. Even Kenneth, the bad-ass mail clerk with the heart of gold. [cut to mail room] Peter: Hi, Kenneth. Hey, did I get any mail? Kenneth: No! But if you come any closer, I'll slice you! Peter: Okay! Okay! Man, what a bad-ass! Man: Yeah? That bad-ass just gave half his paycheck to orphans. Orphans with diseases! [Sentimental instrumental music] Peter: And check out the new toys we're making. Meg: "Baby Smokes-A-Lot"? Baby Smokes-A-Lot: [smokes][Baby giggling] Tastes like happy. Chris: Cool! That's imitatable! Brian: What the hell? El Dorado Cigarettes? That's who bought your company? Lois: Oh, my God! They're trying to corrupt our children! Brian: Well, what do you expect? Those bastards turned a whole generation of Americans into smokers with their damned subliminal advertising. Ma: Timmy, where's Lassie? Timmy: She's out in the orchard, Ma. Peaches are coming in mighty early this year. Jerry: Smoke! Ma: You know what they say, Timmy. "Early peaches, long summer." Jerry: Smoke! Lassie: [Barking] Timmy: What's that, Lassie? Jerry: Are you smoking yet? Lois: Peter, if kids see this doll, they're gonna think smoking's okay. You have to talk to your new bosses first thing in the morning. Peter: Don't you worry, Lois. I'll set them straight. Just like I did with Chris. Chris: Dad, what's the blowhole for? Peter: I'll tell you what it's not for, son. And when I do, you'll understand why I can never go back to Sea World. Peter: Gentlemen, we need to talk. My wife says you're trying to get kids to smoke. Executive: That's just not true. Peter: What about this toy? Executive: Peter, it's just a doll with a cigarette. I mean Barbie has a Dream Car, but you don't see every 8-year-old driving. They're just fun toys. Jerry: Smoke! Executive: Not now, Jerry. Trust me, Peter. The last thing we want is to get kids to start smoking. Peter: What about that graph on the wall that says: "The first thing we want is to get kids to start smoking"? Executive: That? Oh, that's just something my son made me in art class. Peter: Then what about that poster that says: "The graph was not made in art class. We really do want kids to start smoking"? Executive: Look, we're a caring company. I mean, would you really be the president of a company that didn't care about kids? Peter: No. But I'm not the president. Executive: Yes, you are, if you want to be. Men: [Agreeing] Peter: Oh, wow. Imagine, me, president. [Joyful instrumental music] [Peter struts around the Oval Office] Peter: I'll do it! [Griffins' kitchen] Peter: [sings "Hail to the Chief" off-key] Lois: So how did it go? Peter: I'm not finished yet. [more "Hail to the Chief"] Aren't you gonna ask me how it went? Lois: Yes! Did you talk to the company executives? Peter: [more "Hail to the Chief"] Lois: Peter, answer me! Peter: Yeah, I did! They made me president. Meg: Of the whole company? Chris: All right, Dad! Peter: You should've seen the way they were treating me. I never got that kind of respect before. [cut to Peter working as a swim coach] Peter: Great workout, Bobby. Boy: Up yours, sack breath! Peter: That's "Mister Griffin." Lois: But, Peter, why would they make you president? Peter: Maybe it's because I can recite all 50 states in a quarter of a second. [Yelps] Lois: Peter, that was just a loud yelping noise. Peter: Jeez, Lois, I thought you'd be proud of me. After all these years, the company thinks I'm worth something. Wait till you see all the perks we're gonna get. Meg: Um, hi. Can I help you? Ugly Girl: Some company hired me to stand next to you so you'd look better by comparison. Meg: That's ridiculous. I don't need... Boy: Meg, did you get less ugly? Meg: Yeah! Peter: Surprise! Lois: Everything looks the same. Peter: Oh, it looks the same, but actually El Dorado Cigarettes has coated the entire inside of the house with a microfilm of Teflon, so it's easy to clean. Lois: Oh! Peter: Maybe I shouldn't have had them do the floors. Stewie: I'm "Nudes on Ice"! Lois: This is so exciting. Your father's first day as president. Peter: Good morning, First Family. Ooh, Lois, what's in this coffee? Lois: Isn't it wonderful? The company sent Martha Stewart to help me with the housework. I take back all the bad things I said about them. The coffee is delicious, Martha. Martha Stewart: A little chicory perks up the taste of roasted coffee beans. It's a good thing. Brian: Well, I think it's a crappy thing! In fact, this is my last cigarette, ever. You make me sick, letting yourselves be bought off with a few lousy perks. Stewie: Oh, I beg to differ. Valet: Oh, you don't need to park here, Mr. Griffin. You have an executive parking space now. Peter: But that looks exactly like my old space. Valet: Yeah, but this one comes with your own company suck-up. Suck-up: Morning, Mr. Griffin. Nice day. Peter: It's a little cloudy. Suck-up: It's absolutely cloudy, one of the worst days I've seen in years. So, good news about the Yankees. Peter: I hate the Yankees. Suck-up: Pack of cheatters, that's what they are. I love your tie. Peter: I hate this tie. Suck-up: It's awful, it's gaudy, it's gotta go. Peter: And I hate myself. Suck-up: I hate you, too. You make me sick, you fat sack of crap. Peter: But I'm the president. Suck-up: The best there is. Peter: But you just said you hated me. Suck-up: But not you, the president, the you who said you hated you who...love, hate, Yankees, clouds...[head explodes] Valet: I'll have that fixed for you tomorrow, sir. Executive: Here's your new digs. Now, get to work, sport. We're counting on you. Peter: Wow. My own office. Well, I guess I'd better get busy.
