[Pencil sharpening][sighs][sticks finger in pencil sharpener] Ah! [looks furtively around and unzips pants][prolonged screams] [Sinister instrumental music] Executive: Gentlemen, we have a problem. There's an anti-smoking bill before Congress that could put us out of business. Executive 2: Yes. Apparently causing cancer is this year's "hot button." Executive: I don't understand it. We've tried everything to get through to these politicians. Harvard lawyers, lobbyists, wisecracking leprechauns. Leprechaun: Excuse me. Do you have a dollar? I'm a little short. [Laughs] Executive 3: Maybe that's the problem. They're all idiots in Washington. Instead of a smart guy, we should send a moron they can relate to. Executives: Yeah. Yeah. Good thought. Executive: But where are we going to find someone within the company who's that stupid? Executive 2: Yeah. And not just stupid. Fat, too. Executives: Yeah, yeah. That's exactly what we need. Executive 3: Hey, wait a second. Didn't we just make a fat, stupid guy president? Executive: You bet we did. Gentlemen, our new tobacco lobbyist is That Guy! [theme from "That Girl"] Singers: ? Diamonds, daisies, snowflakes, That Guy ? ? Chestnuts, rainbows, springtime is That Guy ? ? He's tinsel on a tree ? ? He's everything that every guy should be ? ? Sable, popcorn, white wine, That Guy ? ? Gingham, bluebirds, Broadway is That Guy ? ? He's mine alone, but luckily for you ? ? if you find a guy to love ? ? only one guy to love then he'll be That Guy, too ? That Guy! Peter: So, uh, what's this big assignment you got for me, Chairman of the Broad? Executive: [Laughs] "Chairman of the Broad." When did you become such a stitch? Peter: Don't you remember? You gave me writers. "Sir, I don't want to say you're rich, but when you walk into a bank, all the tellers go, 'Whoopee!"' That wasn't funny. I thought you guys said you were Jewish. Writer: He's only half-Jewish. Peter: You're fired. Executive: Here's the thing, Griffin. Some troublemakers in Congress are trying to shut us down. We need someone important, like you, to go down to Washington and help those bastards see what kind of fun-Ioving people the tobacco industry's really made of. Peter: Washington? Ah, sweet. I'm your man. But I gotta warn you-I made enemies on the Hill. [Peter at Senate confirmation hearing] Peter: And that's when Clarence Thomas forced me into his chambers and showed me lewd pictures. Senator: Mr. Griffin, we have indisputable evidence that not only have you never been in the same room as Clarence Thomas, you've never been in the same state. How do you respond to that? Peter: Baba Booey! Baba Booey! Howard Stern's penis! Baba Booey! Baba Booey! Baba Booey! Meg: How long will Dad be in Washington? Lois: As long as it takes. He's a very important man now. You know, he's the spokesman for his entire industry. [montage of Peter in cigarette ads] Lois: Thank you, Martha. Brian, could you pass me the TV Guide? Brian: Piss off! Lois: What? Brian: I'm sorry. It just feels like forever since I've had a smoke. I'm just a bit testy. Stop staring at my tail! Peter: Hello, Mr. Harrison? Yeah, I see those government guys you were telling me about. I'll show them a good time and bring them around to our side. Excuse me. Al Gore, George W. Bush? Al Gore: Yes? George W. Bush: Yes? Peter: Ah, great. And what's your friend's name? Al Gore: Dick Armey. Peter: [Laughs] No, seriously. What's his name? Al Gore: Dick Armey. Peter: [Laughs] Al Gore: [Laughs] Oh, I just got it. Peter: Hey, Armey. What's your wife's name? "Vagina Coast Guard"? Nah, I'm kidding, you guys. Hey, get in the car. We're going to a skin bar. All: Great. Yeah. Sounds good. Senator: Oh, my God! Oh, my God! Oh, my God! Oh, my God! I don't know what happened! Peter: Whoa, it's okay, it's okay, Senator. This girl didn't have a family. It'll be like she never existed. Now grab a hold of yourself. All right. Now, listen. You may have killed her when you shoved those dollar bills down her throat. You may have killed her when you hit her with the stool. I don't know. I'm not a doctor. But I'll tell you what didn't kill her. Smoking! Al Gore: You have our support, Griffin. Lois: Look, kids. Here's your father in People magazine with Jim Carrey. And they're both "Smokin'!" I loved that in Mask. "Smokin'!" "Smokin'!" "Smokin'!" Brian: Damn it! Do I have to listen to this drivel 24 hours a day? But I guess anything's better than looking at your smelly face! Meg: Mom! Lois: Honey, your face smells fine. You know he doesn't mean it. It's just the lack of nicotine. Chris: Hey, Mom, the school janitor said that Dad's working for the bad guys. And he said it through a hole in his throat. Lois: Well, That doesn't make him right. Chris: If I had a hole in my throat, I'd put pennies in it! Lois: Listen, your father's doing great work, and life's never been better. Stewie: Yes, I, too, applaud the oaf for finally showing some initiative. God knows he was years overdue. [Stewie lights a cigarette] Lois: [Gasps] Stewie: You know who I saw at the market today? Patty Croft. Oh, and she has gotten fat! Lois: Oh, my God! Stewie, no! Oh, God. What have I done? I knew smoking was bad, but I still sold my soul. And for what? Martha Stewart? Come on, kids. We gotta put a stop to this. Now! Martha Stewart: [Sighs] Finally. [Farting] [Schoolhouse Rock music] Bill: ? They call me Bill, yes, they call me Bill ? ? And I'm standing here on Capitol... ? [screams] Bob Dole Bob Dole's a friend of the tobacco industry. Bob Dole likes your style. Bob Dole. Bob Dole. Bob Dole. Bob Dole. Bob Dole. Bob Dole. Bob Dole. Bob Dole. Bob Dole.... Lois: There you are! Peter, I caught Stewie smoking. That cigarette company is evil. We can't be a part of this anymore. Peter: Lois, this is the best job I ever had! Hey, since I became president, profits have been higher than Alyssa Milano. [Laughs] [cut to Alyssa Milano in live action watching Family Guy] Alyssa Milano: What kind of cheap shot...Joel! Joel: I'm suing. I'm suing. I'm on it. Aide: Mr. Griffin, time for your speech. Lois: But, Peter, what about your son? Peter: So Stewie had a puff. He's old enough to make his own decisions. For God's sakes, Lois, he's 1. Cut the umbilical cord! [Applauding] Peter: Ladies and gentlemen of Congress, I am here today to talk about smoking. Lois: Please, Peter, do the right thing. Peter: I know a lot of you are already on my side. And for you naysayers, I have two strong words for you: come on! Come on! Congressmen: Okay, sure. All right. Done. Peter: Thank you, ladies and... Stewie: [Stewie coughing] Baby needs to suck ash! Baby needs to suck ash! Not "ass," you pervert. Save it for the interns. Peter: Is that a baby? Oh, my God! That's Stewie! Lois was right! Children under 4 shouldn't smoke! Look, I don't care about this stupid job anymore. Cigarettes are bad! Congressman: Mr. Griffin is right! Smoking is a horrible vice! It shortens life expectancy and pollutes our air. And according to recent polls, air is good. Congressman 2: Cigarettes killed my father and raped my mother! [Gasps] Congressman Frank: Gentlemen, I propose we send a message to tobacco companies everywhere by fining the El Dorado Cigarette Company infinity billion dollars! Congressman 3: That's the spirit, Frank! But I think a real number might be more effective. All in favor of fining this evil tobacco giant $100 million, say "Aye"! Congressmen: Aye! Aye! Executive: But that'll bankrupt us! Peter: Oh, you mean the way you've morally bankrupted America? Congressmen: [Laughing] Peter: Thanks for that zinger, boys. Now, give me a snappy line to go out on. Writer: Actually, our lunch is here. Peter: [Stuttering] Well, that's my mama! [Laughing nervously] [Heroic instrumental music] [cut to the Griffins backstage]

name: Chris
line: Merry Christmas, dude. Don't put it in your nose. It burns like hell.

name: Cleveland
line: Merry Christmas, everybody. As president of the Quahog Chamber of Commerce, I'd like to thank the Seniors' Center for decorating our tree.

name: Senior
line: Oop, broke my hip!

name: Lois
line: Look, honey. There's the manger for the Christmas pageant. You're gonna make the cutest baby Jesus ever.

name: Stewie
line: So, you want to dress me up and trot me about like a circus poodle, hmm? Here, let me consult my agent, Mr. Irving R. Pointy Stick!

name: Lois
line: Oh, Stewie, no sweets before dinner.

name: Meg
line: Mom, I'm freezing. Can we go home?

name: Lois
line: In a minute. Would you just look at this beautiful tree? Every year I look up at that star and I think of all of the joy and wonder that Christmas promises. And that miracle that occurred on that silent winter's night.

name: Peter
line: Hey, I'm on vacation! Happy birthday, Jesus! ? Seven maids a-milking, six maids a-milking, five maids a-milk... ?

name: Lois
line: Brian, you're not wearing the sweater I made you.

name: Brian
line: Uh, well, it's a little warm in here, you know?

name: Lois
line: "Don we now our gay apparel"

name: Brian
line: Doesn't get much gayer than this.

name: Lois
line: Peter, tomorrow's Christmas Eve and you still haven't gotten us a tree.

name: Peter
line: Lois, I told you I'm on dipsaluscious vacation. What part of that don't you understand?

name: Lois
line: Come on, honey. It's the only thing I've asked you to do. Please?

name: Peter
line: Brian, tape this for me.

name: Brian
line: Sorry. The VCR hasn't worked since you tried to tape Monday Night Football.

name: FBI Agent
line: Do you have the express written consent of ABC Sports and the National Football League?

name: Peter
line: Just ABC.

name: Lois
line: Well, if you get us a tree, I'll make sure Santa brings you a new VCR. Please?

name: Peter
line: Oh, crap. How come I...commercial! [Chopping tree]

name: Meg
line: Hey, Mom, I got something to add to my Christmas list. A pair of those jeweled bug barrettes. Not costume, real. Maybe you should write that down?

name: Lois
line: Santa got all his shopping done before the rush. I think you'll be very happy.

name: Chris
line: I just want peace on Earth. That's better than being selfish like Meg, right? So I should get more than her.

name: Peter
line: Here's the tree. Merry Christmas to all and to all shut the hell up.

name: Lois
line: Uh-uh-uh, before you sit down, we're due at Joe and Bonnie's for eggnog.

name: Peter
line: Lois, can't we tell them that your mother died?

name: Lois
line: Peter, I'm not gonna lie about something like that.

name: Peter
line: All right, all right, I'll kill your mother. God, when did Christmas become so complicated?

name: Peter
line: So, uh, you guys know that Rudolph is on, right?

name: Lois
line: Peter!

name: Bonnie
line: Thank you for the lovely gingerbread house, Lois.

name: Joe
line: Oh, yeah! It's perfect for all the happy, active gingerbread men. Except for the one with no legs! Look at the parents telling their kids not to stare. "How does his pee-pee work, Mommy?" Well, I've got news for you, Becky. Not so well!

name: Bonnie
line: Joe, you promised. It's Christmas. Joe had his accident at Christmas time.

name: Lois
line: [Nervous laughter]

name: Carolers
line: "Check the balls on Uncle Charlie"

name: Peter
line: Yes! Time to go a-wassailing!

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, Peter.

name: Cleveland
line: Hi. I'm Prancer.

name: Lois
line: Hey, why don't you take Joe along?

name: Peter
line: Yeah, Lois. That'll be about as much fun as a lecture on ontological empiricism.

name: Lois
line: What?

name: Peter
line: What?

name: Lois
line: Honey, he could use some Christmas spirit. For me? Please?

name: Peter
line: All right. But you owe me later, under the mistletoe. Open mouth, no matter how drunk I am.

name: Lois
line: Peter, the gifts are hidden in the trunk. Don't forget to drop off the one for Toys for Toddlers.

name: Peter
line: All right, all right. Hey, somebody give me a beer.

name: Quagmire
line: Heads up.

name: Joe
line: Yeah, Peter, one of us has to be the designated driver. And I've already had four eggnogs. So I guess you're it.

name: Peter
line: That's a good one, Joe. Way to get into the spirit.

name: Joe
line: I'm a cop first and a buddy second. So don't think I wouldn't throw your drunk-driving ass in the slammer! All right, let's a-wassail!

name: Lois
line: Stewie, honey, time for bed. You have a big day tomorrow, baby Jesus.

name: Stewie
line: Trust me, woman, if I could walk on water, I would stroll you out to the middle of a lake and hold your head under until the bubbles stopped!

name: Lois
line: Someone's being naughty, not nice. You know, Santa's watching you.

name: Stewie
line: What the devil do you mean, "watching"?

name: Lois
line: Well, honey, Santa's making a list and checking it twice.

name: Meg
line: He sees you when you're sleeping.

name: Chris
line: And he knows when you're awake. I almost caught him last year. But he's magic!

name: Stewie
line: Constant surveillance of every child on Earth? Impossible! Unless...hidden cameras. Oh, very clever. Watching to see if I'm naughty, are you? Well, check this twice!

name: Cleveland
line: ? Rock the boat ?

name: Cleveland
line: ? Don't rock the boat, baby ?

name: Cleveland
line: ? Rock the boat ?

name: Cleveland
line: ? Don't tip the boat over ?

name: Cleveland
line: ? Rock the boat ?

name: Cleveland
line: ? Don't rock the boat, baby ?

name: Cleveland
line: ? Rock the boat! ?

name: Joe
line: Rock on!

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, guys. Check me out! Whoa!

name: Joe
line: [Grunting] [Screaming] Oh, no! I've broken my legs!

name: Peter
line: That's about as funny as Sinbad. Not the comedian, he's hilarious-the sailor. But then again, he was never meant to be funny. Now come on. I gotta go to freakin' Toys for Toddlers.

name: Cleveland
line: Sounds like somebody's got a humbug up his butt.

name: Quagmire
line: Maybe we should set him up with another lemon snow cone, eh?

name: Peter
line: No, thanks. The last one you gave me didn't taste like lemon at all! It tasted like...oh, you guys are asses!

name: Santa
line: I knew you were awake.

name: Stewie
line: You!

name: Santa
line: Now, Stewie, you are in my power.

name: Stewie
line: No, damn you! Damn you, let me go!

name: Santa
line: Good, Melvin. Nice work, Woodrow. Excellent, Stewie.

name: Stewie
line: Aah! It was just a dream. I needn't fear this Santa. If he were truly omnipotent, he'd have the testicular fortitude to show himself! See? I'm just barking at the dark. No one here but me. [nervously humming] All right, where is it? Where's the wire? Show yourself, Claus!

name: Lois
line: Stewie, go to sleep!

name: Stewie
line: This doesn't involve you, Lois!

name: Lois
line: I don't want to have to come in there.

name: Stewie
line: I don't want to have to come in there!

name: Meg
line: Sh. Dad's awake.

name: Peter
line: Don't bother whispering. I don't have a hangover.

name: Brian
line: It's a Christmas miracle!

name: Peter
line: Shouldn't you have your sweater on?

name: Brian
line: [Groaning]

name: Lois
line: [kiss] That's for letting Joe join in your reindeer games. Now you go relax while I make my little Christmas angel a big stack of pancakes.

name: Peter
line: If I'm sleeping, just stuff 'em in my mouth and rub my throat.

name: Lois
line: Just one more thing.

name: Peter
line: Lois!

name: Lois
line: I need you to take the presents out of the trunk.

name: Brian
line: Aren't you gonna do it?

name: Peter
line: It's already done. I dropped them all off at Toys for Toddlers last night.

name: Brian
line: All? Peter, only one gift was for charity. The rest were for the family.

name: Peter
line: No. The rest were "from" the family. Weren't they? Oh, crap. Since when did they change the meaning of "for" to "from"?

name: Brian
line: I think they had a meeting about it last night.

name: Peter
line: Why wasn't I told?

name: Brian
line: They sent you a card. But it said "For Peter" on it. So you must've thought it was "from" you, so you didn't...you know, it's just easier to call you stupid.

name: Brian
line: You're really gonna take back donated gifts on Christmas Eve?

name: Peter
line: Yep. Now here's the plan. You'll enter through the air conditioning duct here. Now, there'll be an invisible laser grid three inches above the floor. So you'll have to compress your body to the size of a household sponge and slide underneath like some kind of weird amphibious dolphin.

name: Brian
line: Can I buy some pot from you?

name: Hick mother
line: What 'choo want?

name: Hicks
line: [Hollering]

name: Peter
line: So you understand all these gifts were supposed to be for my family. It was just some crazy mix-up.

name: Hick Mother
line: Kill 'em.

name: Hick Father
line: [Pumps shotgun]

name: Peter
line: No, no, no. It's true. You see, that remote control cow was for my son. And those barrettes were for my daughter. And, uh.... Hey, where's my VCR?

name: Buck
line: It's my sex box! And her name is "Sony."

name: Lois
line: You gave away all the presents?

name: Peter
line: Lois, if you strike me down, I shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.

name: Lois
line: Peter, you brought glad tidings to a family less fortunate than your own.

name: Peter
line: You mean you're not mad?

name: Lois
line: Well, I am little irritated that I have to do all the shopping again. But at least some good came out of it.

name: Peter
line: So I can drink beer and watch TV? 'cause, you know, KISS Saves Santa's on.

name: Ace Frehley
line: But, Mrs. Claus, who would kidnap Santa?

name: Claus
line: Well, Ace, that's what I want you boys to find out.

name: Gene Simmons
line: Someone stole Santa? That does not rock!

name: Paul Stanley
line: Easy, Gene. Guys, let's go save Christmas. To the KISS Copter!

name: KISS
line: [Cheering]

name: Lois
line: You can watch all the TV you want-[kiss]-just as soon as we get back from the mall.

name: Peter
line: The mall? On Christmas Eve?

name: Lois
line: Peter, I just want this family to have a perfect Christmas. And I need a little help, okay? Brian, my turkey's in the oven. Can you turn it off at 3:00?

name: Brian
line: No problem.

name: Lois
line: We'll shop, come home, eat, and then it's off to the pageant to see our little Stewie play baby Jesus.

name: Stewie
line: Oh, yes, yes. By all means, turn me into a child star. Perhaps I can move to Cal-i-for-ni-a and wrangle me a three-way with the Olsen twins.

name: Lois
line: There's a spot!

name: Peter
line: Ah, screw this.

name: Lois
line: Okay, Peter. We'll each take half the list to save time. Kids, why don't you take Stewie to see Santa?

name: Stewie
line: Santa?

name: Stewie
line: No, it's not possible! Sitting alone in this public setting? No bullet-proof glass? Claus, you make it too easy. Change me! I've leaked through my ski pants and I won't face him wet!

name: Announcer
line: We now return to Bob Hope's Christmas with the Troops.

name: Bob Hope
line: It's good to see you Union boys. I would've been here sooner, but Lincoln gave me the wrong "Gettysburg Address." How about this having to sit still for 60 seconds to have your picture taken? How 'bout that?

name: Peter
line: Sweet! It's KISS Saves Santa.

name: Ace Frehley
line: Hang on, Santa. We're coming.

name: Santa
line: Hurry, boys. The eggs are hatching!

name: Peter Kriss
line: What do we do?

name: Paul Stanley
line: Wait a second. Everyone knows pterodactyls can't stand the screech of a guitar!

name: Gene Simmons
line: It's working!

name: KISS
line: Hey, Santa, be careful! Oh, no! Hang on, Santa!

name: Peter
line: Hey, I was watching that! Hey!

name: Clerk
line: It'll be on next Christmas.

name: Peter
line: Who the hell knows when that's gonna be?

name: Brian
line: Ah! If I was an oven mitt...

name: Brian
line: Damn it, Peter!

name: Santa
line: Ho, ho, ho. And what can I bring you this year?

name: Stewie
line: Oh, a peace offering is it? Very well, what say you trim those gin-soaked whiskers and bring me some plutonium?

name: Santa
line: Well, can you be a good boy?

name: Stewie
line: Your inquiry intrigues me. Can any of us be a good boy? Are our primal urges innate, or the result of the choices we make?

name: Santa
line: Okay. Wrap it up, kid.

name: Stewie
line: All right, Kringle! If the reward is plutonium, then your wager is accepted. I will be "nice."

name: Santa
line: Good boy! Now smile for the camera.

name: Stewie
line: Yes, yes. Smile, like a good boy.

name: Brian
line: Aaaaaah!

name: Peter
line: Aha, Meg's barrettes.

name: Old Woman
line: You mean, Julie's barrettes!

name: Peter
line: You still want 'em, you bony old blue hair? Ow, ow! Tittie twister! Ow, hurts!

name: Peter
line: Aha! All the clown fish and yellow tangs in the world can't help you now. That's it? Fish food? That's your ace in the hole? Hahaha! Oh, God! Ow, ow, ow!

name: Brian
line: Turkey!

name: Brian
line: [Screaming]

name: Peter
line: Oh, Lois, it was horrible. The fish were jumping all over my eyes and in my nose. And on the way out, I think one of them muttered something anti-Semitic.

name: Lois
line: We're almost home, honey. Oh, look. There's the star on the town Christmas tree. We're following it home just like the Three Wise Men.

name: Lois
line: [Gasping] Oh, my God! Brian, are you okay?

name: Chris
line: I told you we should've left cookies for Santa.

name: Peter
line: [Hollering] My couch! My TV! What the hell did you do?

name: Brian
line: Me? Who the hell buys a novelty fire extinguisher?

name: Peter
line: I'll tell you who. Someone who cares enough about physical comedy to put his whole family at serious risk.

name: Lois
line: Boys, please. It's Christmas Eve. This is a night for magic, and wonder, and joy. Okay, so a couple of things have gone wrong. But we can still have a great Christmas.

name: Peter
line: [Sighing] Aw jeez, kids. You know, I was this close to losing it. But your mom's right.

name: Lois
line: Well, sure I am. Meg, honey, get me some paper towels. Let's lose the bad tidings, clean up this mess, and find that holiday cheer.

name: All
line: [Muttering in agreement]

name: Meg
line: We're out of paper towels.

name: Lois
line: No paper towels? [Screaming]

name: Peter
line: Hey, I was gonna pick at that.

name: Lois
line: Shut your fat mouth! You all think Christmas just happens? You think all this goodwill just falls from the freakin' sky? Well, it doesn't! It falls out of my holly jolly butt! So, you can cook your own damn turkey and wrap your own damn presents! And while you're at it, you can all ride a one-horse open sleigh to hell! [Screaming] [Panting maniacally]

name: Meg
line: Oh. Here's the paper towels.

name: George Bailey
line: I-I changed my mind! Clarence, I want to live again! [Screaming]

name: Frosty the Snowman
line: Hey, I guess there's some magic in that old silk hat.

name: Lois
line: [snarling]

name: Frosty the Snowman
line: Merry Christmas!

name: Lois
line: You want some of this! [Mindless cackling]

name: Frosty the Snowman
line: Ah! What the hell is her problem?

name: Frosty the Snowman
line: Just a second, just a second. Hey, lady, you got something to say to me?

name: Lois
line: Wish? It's easy to wish. But does anyone take responsibility and make it happen? No! You all expect someone else to do it for you like Santy Claus or Mommy!

name: Frosty the Snowman
line: [Screaming] What the.... Ah! Take it off! Take it off!

name: Lois
line: Must kill star.

name: Chris
line: Dad, what happened to Mom? What if she never comes back?

name: Peter
line: I think the bigger question is if this is the way she's gonna act at Christmas do we even want her back?

name: Stewie
line: Which is better? Around the waist or off the shoulder? Waist? Shoulder? Waist? Shoulder?

name: Meg
line: Stewie, I thought you didn't want to be in the pageant.

name: Stewie
line: Oh, Megan, Santa would think it terribly naughty of me not to fulfill my obligation to Mother. You know how much the pageant means to her.

name: Chris
line: Where do you think she is?

name: Peter
line: Well, thank God years ago I planted a homing device in your mother's skull for just such an occasion.

name: Peter
line: I forgot. I also put 'em in a bunch of squirrels. This isn't goint to do us any good. May as well see if she's at the pageant.

name: Lois
line: You lied to me.

name: Meg
line: Oh, my God! There's Mom!

name: Peter
line: Hi, Lois! Hey, do we look like ants down here?

name: Lois
line: Bite me!

name: Joe
line: Peter, great time last night. Don't worry. We'll get Lois down.

name: Sniper
line: Locked and loaded, sir.

name: Meg
line: Wait. You can't shoot my mom!

name: Joe
line: Don't worry, kid. It's just a mild sedative. Go!

name: Peter
line: All right, hang on. Look, Lois is only up there because we sucked the Christmas spirit right out of her. Maybe if she sees the pageant it'll bring her around. Give her a chance, eh?

name: Brian
line: Trust him, Joe. This man has seen every Christmas special ever made.

name: Joe
line: Are you wearing a girl's sweater?

name: Brian
line: Does that really matter right now?

name: Joe
line: You got 10 minutes.

name: Peter
line: Lights, please.

name: Peter
line: As we all know, Christmas is that mystical time of year when the ghost of Jesus rises from the grave to feed on the flesh of the living. So we all sing Christmas carols to lull him back to sleep.

name: Bob
line: Outrageous! How dare he say such blasphemy! I've gotta do something!

name: Man
line: Bob, there's nothing you can do.

name: Bob
line: [Sighing] Well, I guess I'll just have to develop a sense of humor.

name: Bonnie
line: I am the Virgin Mary. That's my story and I'm sticking to it. Oh, Our Savior has arrived.

name: Stewie
line: Good evening. I am playing the role of Jesus. A man once portrayed on the big screen by Jeffrey Hunter. You may remember him as the actor who was replaced by William Shatner on Star Trek. Apparently Mr. Hunter was good enough to die for our sins but not quite up to the task of seducing green women. Anyhoo, the perennial dictum is to spread goodwill towards all men. The irony of course is that this is contrary to our nature. So why do we do it? Because we are being watched! And so we unselfishly think of others, assured that our good behavior will be rewarded with love and plutonium.

name: Peter
line: She's not getting it. Okay, boys, take her down.

name: Peter
line: Merry Christmas, buddy.

name: Brian
line: Wonder what this could be...oh.

name: Chris
line: This Christmas rocks!

name: Meg
line: Mom, Stewie's opening his gifts. Mom?

name: Peter
line: It's okay, Meg. Your mom's just full of Christmas cheer and enough tranquilizer to bring down a bull elephant. Uh, honey, you got a little something...you got a little...I'll get it.

name: Stewie
line: Hungry Hungry Hippos? Claus, you porcine double-crosser! And to think I was nice.

name: Brian
line: You got another one, dude.

name: Stewie
line: [gasping] Plutonium! He is real! He's really, really real!

name: Brian
line: So, Peter, did you get everything you wanted for Christmas?

name: Peter
line: You bet. A week's vacation, a new VCR. And best of all, my own copy of KISS Saves Santa.

name: Ace Frehley
line: You just practice that guitar, Santa. Next time we'll let you do a solo.

name: Claus
line: Don't encourage him!

name: Brian
line: From all of us at Family Guy...

name: Meg
line: ...we wish you Christmas joy.

name: Chris
line: May all your wishes now come true...

name: Stewie
line: ...for every girl and boy.

name: Peter
line: We hope your freakin' holidays are filled with fun and cheer. So have a Merry Christmas and...

name: Lois
line: [Incomprehensible mumbling]

name: Stewie
line: I say! It's 4:00. Away with you! Meg: Stewie! Chris: Change it back! Brian: Forget it. Jolly Farm Revue is on. It's the latest indoctrinating pablum for children with not enough to do. Stewie: Hey! Shut up! Mother Maggie: Wakey-wakey, children. Children & Stewie: Good morning, Mother Maggie. Mother Maggie: The sun has risen on another day in Jolly Farm. Let's see what life's rich pageant has in store for us. Stewie: Oh, she has the voice of an angel! Not to mention a balcony you could do Shakespeare from. Mother Maggie: Play your song, Melody Sheep, to aid the little ones' nourishment. But play softly, for Pengrove Pig wishes to read aloud from his magic tome that holds every book ever written. Pengrove Pig: "These were difficult times for the children of Ipswich, when the lollipop famine cursed their pleasant village. " Brian: How can you stand watching this? It's dreck and you know it. Oh, don't have the guts to respond, huh? No intelligent defense of this unmitigated crap? Peter: Commercial! <punches Brian> I'm gonna get some graham crackers. Moderator: Welcome back to KISS Forum, Rhode Island Public Access' most popular show about KISS. Peter: Lois, hurry! It's back on! Lois: Calm down, Peter. You know I wouldn't miss a second of this. Moderator: Okay, let's take a call. You're on KISS Forum. Caller 1: KISS rules! Moderator: Okay, good call. Good call. All right. You're on KISS Forum. Caller 2: Yeah. KISS sucks! Moderator: Whoa! Peter: Trace the call! Trace the call! Caller 2: Yeah, they suck big time, man. They bite ass! Moderator: Wait a sec. I recognize that voice! Is this Dennis De Young, lead singer from Styx? Come clean, man. Caller 2: Yeah, yeah, it's me. It's Dennis. Moderator: Dennis, you jealous douche, how about I crank a little 'Detroit Rock City' and play 'Come Sail Away' and we can see how they stack up side by side? Huh? You want that, you high-voiced bastard? We'll be right back, after this. Paul Stanley: Hey! Didn't see you come in. We're getting into shape for our upcoming tour. Gene Simmons: We're playing five big shows in five days. So, if you... Ace Frehley: Rock and roll! Gene Simmons: Why, Why don't you just sit in the corner, huh? Go on. If you're a KISS fan, and you live in the Northeast come out for all five shows of what we're calling "KISS-Stock." Peter: Aw, Hell! The Northeast! It's times like this I curse the fact that we live in French Polynesia. Lois: No, Peter, we're in the Northeast. Peter: We are? And KISS is coming to the Northeast. That means...aw. Lois: That means- Peter: No, no, Lois! Don't help me! It means we can do something. Lois: Come on, Peter. You're almost there. <Peter is at the dentist> Peter: We can go to KISS-Stock! Dentist: Owww! Peter: Hey, yo, Lois! Lois: What? Peter: I'm packing for KISS-stock and I can't find my favorite underwear. Lois: You mean the pair with the rip in the right buttcheek from when you stepped on them pulling them up in that airplane bathroom from when you had the trots? Peter: No, the pair with the hole in the left buttcheek from when I held it in for two hours 'cause it was that extra long Palm Sunday church sermon and blowing gas would offend Jesus, so I let it go in the vestibule after Mass, and it sounded like Louis Armstrong? Lois: Oh, bottom drawer. Mother Maggie: Children, tell Mother Maggie what you want to be when you grow up. Child 1: A scientist. Child 2: A novelist. Child 3: A Cambridge don. Stewie: What's my future coming from these squalid surroundings? Getting into a fight at the Laundromat with some dude who hit on my baby's mama? I should be there, not here! <dreamy music> London. Chris: Hey, Dad? Can me and Meg stay up late every night when you're at KISS-Stock? Peter: You can do whatever you want, son. Just don't eat from the candy tree. Candy Tree: He's right to caution you. I feed on children. Brian: You don't mind watching Stewie for a few days, do you, Brian? Brian: Nah. Ever since Jolly Farm Revue came on, he's been pretty distracted. It'll be a breeze. Lois: Well, 'Bye, everyone. Meg: I can't believe my stupid parents are gonna spend five days following stupid old KISS around. It's painful. Peter: Not half as painful as a tire iron upside your head. Meg: What? Peter: I'll miss you. Brian: Hey, Stewie, what do you want for lunch? <finds note from Stewie> Stewie: <voiceover> Dear stupid dog, I've gone to live with the children on Jolly Farm. Good-bye forever, Stewie. P.S. I never got a chance to return that sweater Lois gave me for Christmas. Um, I left the receipt on top of my bureau. I'm probably over the 30-day return limit but I'm sure if you make a fuss they'll at least give you a store credit or something. It's actually not a horrible sweater. It's just, I can't imagine when I would ever wear it , you know? I also left a button on the bureau. I'm not sure what it goes to but I can never bring myself to throw a button away. I know as soon as I do I'll find the garment it goes to, and then it'll.... Wait a minute. Actually, could it have been from the sweater? Did that sweater have buttons? Well, I should wrap this up before I start to ramble. Again, good-bye forever. P.P.S. You know, it might be a little chilly in London. I'm actually going to take the sweater. Brian: Oh, my God! <Quahog Airport> Stewie: One of these planes must be going to London. British mother: Queue up, children. Spit spot. Here are the tickets, miss. These are all ours. Thank you. Stewie: Spit spot, Albert Hall, meat and two veg, Big Ben, Dave Clark Five, Spam and eggs, a baby's arm holding an apple, pip pip, cheerio. [Dramatic instrumental music] <Stewie boards plane, throwing a Nixon victory wave on the way on. Brian rushes through the airport, sneaking aboard the plane through the cargo hold> Flight Attendant: Hot towel? Stewie: Yes, thank you. <drops drawers> Well, come on! <Brian grabs Stewie> Stewie: What the hell are you doing here? Brian: I'm taking you off this plane. Stewie: Think again, Rover.

name: Brian
line: Great. I'm stuck on a trans-Atlantic flight with a petulant runaway. How could this get any worse?

name: Andy Rooney
line: You know what I hate about flying? The peanuts. First of all, you can't get them open. Who are they trying to keep out of these things? Seinfeld: And what's the deal with the razor-blade slot in the bathroom? Are people actually shaving in there? Andy Dick: Hi, Andy Dick here. Excuse me. I've got to get my bag up in the overhead bin here. [Yelling and laughing] Wow, that's wacky! Stewie: There now, that wasn't so bad, was it? Did you sleep at all? Brian: Yeah, a little.

name: Stewie
line: I couldn't sleep a wink-my pillow smelled like farts. But that's all right, because we're in England. Brian: Uh-oh. [Middle Eastern instrumental music]

name: Stewie
line: Well, I don't get it. Where are England's verdant fields, its rosy-rumped maids, and buck-toothed solicitors? Brian: About 3,000 miles that way. We're in the Middle East.

name: Stewie
line: Where are we going? Brian: I don't know. I'm not exactly familiar with this particular Arabian village.

name: Stewie
line: Great. Buy one and let's get out of here. Brian: What do you mean, buy one? All I've got is $50. We're gonna have to distract him. Follow my lead. Stewie & Brian: ? You and I are so awfully different ? ? Too awfully different, to ever be pals ?

name: Stewie
line: Do you want to go first? Brian: Yeah, I'll go. ? Your favorite hero is the Marquis de Sade ?

name: Stewie
line: Oh, you're one to talk. ? You get a stiffy from Phylicia Rashad ? Brian: Oh, one time

name: Stewie
line: ? I'm a style flair, just look at my hip hair ?

name: Brian
line: Oh yeah, thats quite a nice 'do there Stewie: Oh, thanks.

name: Brian
line: <Triumph the Insult Comic Dog voice> For me to poop on! Stewie: What?

name: Brian
line: Oh c'mon, you look like Charlie Brown. Stewie: Bite me, Snoopy

name: Brian
line: ? There's not, a whole lot, that we've got, to agree on ? Brian: 'Cause I love the strings of a classical score.

name: Stewie
line: And I like that singer who looks like a whore. Brian: Ricky Martin? Stewie: Love him. Stewie & Brian: ? We're too different to ever be pals ?? You and I are ?

name: Locals
line: ? Dododo ? Stewie & Brian: ? so awfully different ?

name: Locals
line: ? Dododo ?

name: Brian
line: ? Too awfully different ?

name: Locals
line: ? Dododo ?

name: Brian
line: ? to ever be pals ? Locals: ? Dododo dodo dodo doooo dodo ?

name: Brian
line: ? Your head's as massive as a meteorite ? Stewie: Oh, very funny. ? You have a weenie like a christmas tree light ?

name: Brian
line: ? I'd bet money, you'll marry a honey ? ? Whose pretty and funny ? ? And her name will be Ted ?

name: Stewie
line: Oh a gay joke. Brian: I just work with what you give me.

name: Brian
line: ? You might think we're in sync ? ? But we stink, as a duo ? Brian: ? 'Cause you get a kick out of carnage and guts ?

name: Stewie
line: ? And you get a kick out of stroking your... ? Brian: Whoa, whoa, whoa, you can't say that on TV

name: Stewie
line: What? Ego? Brian: Never mind.

name: Brian
line: ? We're too different to ever be pals ? Brian: Oh, man! We're screwed. We're lost in the desert, we have no food, no water, and our camel is dead from exhaustion. Stewie: And I had named him and given him a back-story. Chucky had the biggest hump of the camels in his village. And he was picked on for it. But then there was a terrible drought and Chucky went to the oasis, because he was like that. He drank and drank, and stored enough water in his massive hump to slake the thirst of the entire...

name: Brian
line: Cut the maudlin crap. We're in trouble here. It's already below freezing, and it's getting colder. We're gonna die unless-unless we do something drastic. Stewie: What? Brian: We must slice open our camel's stomach and shelter ourselves in his entrails. Stewie: Eviscerate Chucky? I won't do it!

name: Brian
line: Look, we're gonna die if we don't. Stewie: All right. <Brian slices open camel> Oh, God! It's like Orson Welles' autopsy.

name: Brian
line: All right, just hold your breath and go. What are you doing? Stewie: Wiping my feet. I don't want to track any sand inside. Once you get it in there, you can't get it out. Oh God! I just threw up in his lung!

name: Brian
line: Look, I know it's gross, but when you're desperate and you stare death in the face, you have no choice but to.... There's a Comfort Inn. Stewie: Really?

name: Brian
line: Yeah. Good luck for us, huh? Stewie: You know, once you feng shui the organs, it's kind of cozy. [Loud heavy metal music] Lois: Oh, isn't this exciting?

name: Man
line: Anyone got a light? Thanks.

name: Lois
line: Peter, look, there's Dave and Dottie, the nudists.

name: Dave
line: Well, hey there, Griffins!

name: Lois
line: Dave, Dottie, what a pleasant surprise! Dottie: Don't tell me you're KISS freaks, too?

name: Peter
line: KISS army soldier since 1977. How about you?

name: Dave
line: '76. I don't think anyone knows more about KISS than I do.

name: Peter
line: I'm sorry. What was that?

name: Lois
line: It's not important.

name: Peter
line: Let him answer, Lois!

name: Dave
line: I said, no one knows more about KISS than I do.

name: Dottie
line: Fellows, please keep it civil.

name: Peter
line: I'm not sure I like the tone of your voice, Dave.

name: Dave
line: Well, throw down, if that's what you want.

name: Peter
line: Name Gene Simmons' special-effects mentor. Dave: Amazo the Magician. What high school did Paul Stanley go to?

name: Peter
line: New York High School of Music. Paul and Gene's band before KISS?

name: Dave
line: Wicked Lester. What year did KISS appear on the Jim Nabor's Halloween special?

name: Peter
line: Trick question. It was Paul Lynde, and it was 1975. Now recite the ad that brought Peter Criss to Paul and Gene's attention.

name: Dave
line: "Drummer willing to do anything to make it." Rolling Stone, October, 1972.

name: Dave
line: Exemplary.

name: Peter
line: Rock 'n' roll!

name: Brian
line: How in the hell are we gonna get out of here?

name: Stewie
line: Are you going to finish your red paste?

name: Brian
line: No.

name: Stewie
line: What about your sweet crusty thing?

name: Brian
line: No, you can have it.

name: Father
line: No more balloon for you. I am sick of you tooling around the village in it, honking at the girls, blasting your 1980s American rock music that we got here last week.

name: Son
line: But, Father... Father: Go to your palace!

name: Brian
line: Are you thinking what I'm thinking? Stewie: Oh, yes. Just wait until they have to suffer through Jesus Jones. [Makes a disgusted sound]

name: Brian
line: Not that, the balloon!

name: Stewie
line: Oh, yes. The balloon. Let's take it.

name: Brian
line: Wow! I didn't know it really looked like that.

name: Stewie
line: Neither did I. <the landscape below the balloon looks like an actual map> Such lovely printing, too. <at KISS-stock>

name: KISS
line: ?You keep on shoutin', you keep on shoutin'?

name: Peter
line: Oh, Lois, here comes the best part.

name: KISS
line: ?I wanna rock and roll all night...?

name: Lois
line: "And have a wonderful time" [Band stops playing]

name: Lois
line: Is that it? Oh, no no. "And something, something all day" Right?

name: Gene Simmons
line: Oh, man! I've lost all faith in mankind.

name: Paul Stanley
line: Music is dead to me now. <Simmons and Stanley leave stage>

name: Peter Criss
line: Hey, now's our chance!

name: Ace Frehley
line: Let's do it! <Criss and Frehley sing and dance to 'Chattanooga Choo Choo'> Stewie: I say! Where the hell are we? Cardinal: Pope! Pope! It's time to get up and put on your hat.

name: Pope
line: It's a stupid hat!

name: Cardinal
line: Pope!

name: Pope
line: All right, okay. God! Cardinal: Pope, the floor is not a hamper!

name: Pope
line: Man! Cardinal: Good. Now it's time to go on the balcony and address the people.

name: Pope
line: [Speaking Latin] <the Pope is hit by the balloon and knocked onto a statue below> [Pope screaming]

name: Brian
line: All right, all we've got to do is find the American Embassy and they'll help us get home. Stewie: Home? I have no intention of returning to that disgusting hovel with that intolerable woman, that fat slob, and that insufferable dog. Oh, you're right here, aren't you? Oh, well, I stand by it. My future is with Jolly Farm.

name: Brian
line: You really think that, don't you? Stewie: I know it.

name: Brian
line: Okay, we've got three days until Peter and Lois get back from their KISS concerts. Let's go to Jolly Farm. Stewie: Yeah, now you're talking!

name: Pope
line: You make the Pope look like a fool! God will make you pay. Smite them! He's cooking something up. [Train whistle] Stewie: I say! Brian, look. Three rows down.

name: Brian
line: What? Stewie: Is that Tom Bosley?

name: Brian
line: What would Tom Bosley be doing on a train in Switzerland? Stewie: I'm almost certain. Tom! Did he look?

name: Brian
line: I don't know. Stewie: If I yell, you have to watch. Tom Bosley!

name: Brian
line: No, it's not him. Tour Guide: Besides its beautiful historic architecture Munich was the home of many great writers such as Thomas Mann. You will find more on Germany's contribution to the arts in the pamphlets we have provided.

name: Brian
line: Yeah, about your pamphlet. Uh, I'm not seeing anything about German history between 1939 and 1945. There's just a big gap.

name: Tour Guide
line: Everyone was on vacation! On your left is Munich's first city hall erected in 15...

name: Brian
line: Wait, wait. What are you talking about? Germany invaded Poland in 1939 and... Tour Guide: We were invited! Punch was served! Check with Poland!

name: Brian
line: You can't just ignore those years. Thomas Mann fled to America because of Nazism's stranglehold on Germany.

name: Tour Guide
line: Nope. Nope. He left to manage a Dairy Queen.

name: Brian
line: A Dairy Queen? That's preposterous. Tour Guide: I will hear no more insinuations about the German people! Nothing bad happened! [Yelling in German] <gives Nazi salute>

name: Brian
line: Uh, is that a beer hall?

name: Tour Guide
line: Oh, yes. Munich is renowned for its historic beer halls.

name: Lois
line: Why is everybody glaring at us?

name: Peter
line: Why, Lois? I'll tell you why. Your faux pas last night at the concert was so upsetting I had to call a university professor to tell me what phrase to use to describe it. Professor: Use "faux pas."

name: Peter
line: Thanks, professor. Peter: You've been living a lie all these years. You represented yourself as a KISS fan. And why? To make me look foolish!

name: Lois
line: No. To make you happy. I wanted to share in all aspects of your life, Peter. But I just was never that big a KISS fan.

name: Peter
line: I should've guessed that when you were willing to dress up as Peter Criss. No one wants to be Peter Criss, Lois! Not even Peter Criss!

name: Lois
line: I guess I'm just not as cool as you thought I was.

name: Peter
line: I guess not. <Amsterdam>

name: Brian
line: I'm exhausted. Come on. Let's get a coffee. <enters coffeehouse> The smoke is so acrid.

name: Stewie
line: A man can hardly breathe in here.

name: Pot Head
line: You should get some hash, man. You can't go wrong.

name: Stewie
line: Not true. Ground meat can go very wrong for me very quickly, and everyone in this room will suffer the consequences!

name: Pot Head
line: You are out there, man, in the ether.

name: Stewie
line: I'd love to further pursue our palaver but I am not fluent in "freak up"! So, I'm just gonna turn back over here, back towards my table.

name: Brian
line: Say, are you hungry?

name: Stewie
line: Well, you know, I wasn't when I came in. But isn't that so funny? I'm getting there.

name: Brian
line: Yeah. Same here.

name: Stewie
line: I think the only reason we die is that...

name: Brian
line: Dude, I know what you're gonna say. And I am so completely... Stewie: Wait, wait, wait! Sh, sh, sh. The only reason we die is because we accept it as an inevitability. Hah.

name: Brian
line: Do you think I'll ever find the right woman?

name: Stewie
line: Oh, God! Yes, man! Come on! Dude, you're great! Lois: Peter, are you ever gonna forgive me?

name: Peter
line: Lois, I am obligated to keep loving you, so I will take my rage out on my own body. Let's go to Denny's. <at Denny's>

name: Peter
line: Oh, man! I don't believe it! KISS is here! We don't deserve to be under the same roof with them. Let's go.

name: Lois
line: All right. I guess I could fix us something when we...Chaim?

name: Peter
line: Lois! Do not address KISS unless they address you first! Lois: Oh, my God! Chaim Witz? It is you.

name: Gene Simmons
line: Which one do you want me to sign? Left or right? Lois: No, no, no. It's Lois. Lois Pewterschmidt. I knew you before you changed your name.

name: Gene Simmons
line: Lois! I don't believe it. It's been ages. Hey, guys, this is the girl I told you about. You know, I knew her before we formed KISS. "Loose" Lois! Paul Stanley: Cool! "Loose" Lois!

name: Peter Kriss
line: The legend herself. Ace Frehley: My Grand Slam was supposed to be with sausage.

name: Lois
line: I never realized you were Gene Simmons the rock star!

name: Gene Simmons
line: You look great, Lois. Anyone nailing you now?

name: Lois
line: Yes, my husband nails me. This is him, Peter. Peter: You-are-gods!

name: Gene Simmons
line: Yeah, thanks, right. We're recording some tracks in Boston next month. You should come on by. Lois: We'd love that, Chaim... I mean Gene, you big rock star. Bye! Wow! Such a small world. He was a nice boy. And he's still nice.

name: Peter
line: Listen, Lois, what I said before...I've never been more wrong in my life. You are the coolest girl in the world! My wife did KISS!

name: Lois
line: And J. Geils. Peter: What?

name: Lois
line: Nothing.

name: Stewie
line: There it is! The BBC! Well, this is it. I'll say good-bye to you now. Brian: Well, have a good life, Stewie. Stewie: Oh, I shall! Oh, hey, I meant to ask you did you find out what the button on my bureau was from? Brian: Oh, yeah. Chris' denim jacket. Stewie: Ah. I like that jacket. It looks good on him. Okay, then. So, we'll keep in touch? Brian: Sure. Stewie: Well, I have your address. See ya! There's Happy Hill! <crashes into set wall> What the deuce? Pengrove! Pengrove Pig! Pengrove, I've come to live on Jolly Farm! Oh, my! The magic tome. But it's cardboard. And there are no words. There are just.... What is it you've drawn here? Pengrove Pig: That's Oswald Owl slamming Mother Maggie in one of them Chinese baskets. <takes off pig head> Dead brill, eh? Stewie: Ah! Mother Maggie! Thank God! Something's terribly wrong. Mother Maggie: Whose stinky brat is this? Stewie: What? That's not your voice. Your voice is lyrical, like the gentle strum of a lute. Mother Maggie: Piss off, you grotty little wanker! Stewie: It's a fake. It's not real. Brian: I thought it'd be best for you to find out on your own, kid. Stewie: I feel like such a fool. Don't even look at me! Brian: Hey, come on. You want to get some ice cream? That'd make you feel better, right? You want to get some McDonald's? Do you want to take a dump in Mother Maggie's shoes? Okay. Let's go take a dump in Mother Maggie's shoes. Meg: Jolly Farm is on, Stewie. Don't you want to watch? Stewie: The Stewie who loved Jolly Farm is dead, Megan. Meet the Stewie who loves funky fruit hats! [Humming tropical music] Meg: Turn it up! Mom and Dad are on! Moderator: We're back with more KISS Forum. I'm with the Griffins. They got something really exciting to share. Peter: Yeah. My wife here did KISS. Moderator: Get out of here! Lois: Hand to God. Moderator: Peter! How does that make you feel? Peter: I feel like I've done KISS, too, Donny. And it feels good. Moderator: Lois, you got any tips for the young girls in the audience tonight? Lois: Well, I guess the best advice I can give is that you never know who's gonna grow up to be famous. So, just make yourself available. Moderator: Cool. Cool. Well, that's our show for tonight. Now stay tuned for Battlestar Galactica Forum. <dons Cylon helmet> Welcome to Battlestar Galactica Forum. [Closing Theme music]

name: Brian
line: Hi, I'm Brian Griffin.

name: Stewie
line: And I'm Stewart.

name: Brian
line: : Many of you have written to the show with suggestions for episodes you'd like to see.

name: Stewie
line: They're mostly God-awful.

name: Brian
line: : Well, tonight we took your advice and produced three of our favorite suggestions.

name: Stewie
line: Favorites? Oh, that's charitable.

name: Brian
line: What is that?

name: Stewie
line: I got this from 'Dharma and Greg'.

name: Brian
line: I'm surprised there's anything left in it.

name: BOTH
line: Whoa!

name: Brian
line: Enjoy.

name: Title card
line: No Bones About It>

name: Announcer
line: And now back to The Newlywed Game.

name: Host
line: Carol, how did Nick answer the following: the last thing I would ever give my wife is 'blank'?"

name: Wife
line: A little spending money?

name: Host
line: I'm sorry, that's incorrect. Nick actually said "the antidote."

name: Wife
line: Nick, what are you talking about?

name: Lois
line: Oh, Meg, you were right.

name: Peter
line: Oh, my God! A genie!

name: Genie
line: I am here to grant you three wishes.

name: Lois
line: Peter, three wishes! Oh, this is so exciting!

name: Meg
line: I want a new hat!

name: Chris
line: I want a new hat!

name: Stewie
line: I want them to have new hats!

name: Lois
line: Kids, these are your father's wishes. Go ahead, honey. Get whatever you want.

name: Peter
line: That's easy. I wish I could see what Kelly Ripa was like off the set.

name: Genie
line: So it shall be.

name: Regis Philbin
line: Great show today, Kelly.

name: Kelly Ripa
line: Thanks, Reg. You, too.

name: Regis Philbin
line: Kelly, Gelman needs us on stage for a couple of re-shoots.

name: Kelly Ripa
line: Be right there, Reg. I just have to put on my face.

name: Lois
line: My goodness! Did you see the size of that dressing room?

name: Peter
line: Yes. They must really want to keep her.

name: Genie
line: Your second wish?

name: Peter
line: I got just the thing. I wish I had my own theme music.

name: Genie
line: Done!

name: Peter
line: I don't hear anything.

name: Genie
line: Get up. Try it out.

name: Peter
line: Sweet.

name: Peter
line: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

name: Man
line: Hey, buddy, want to turn that stuff down?

name: Peter
line: Come on, pal. That's classic traveling music. Try to enjoy it.

name: Peter
line: ?Riding on a bus? ?Riding on a bus? ?Sitting next to bums? ?There's an open seat? ?Hope that isn't pee?

name: Man
line: Yeah! I'm sick of hearing it!

name: Peter
line: Look, I'm sorry, buddy. I can't turn it off.

name: Man
line: Well, then I'm gonna break every bone in your body.

name: Peter
line: I wish I had no bones!

name: Genie
line: Done.

name: Peter
line: That ought to show you!

name: Peter
line: Oh, no. I got to fart. But I don't know which way to lean.

name: Peter
line: I know you might be a little concerned about me not having bones and all. But I got to tell you, it's not that bad.

name: Chris
line: Dad's just like Silly Putty. Look what I can do to Mary Worth's smug sense of self-satisfaction.

name: Peter
line: That's right, son. Take her down a peg.

name: Lois
line: Well, I guess we could all adjust to this.

name: Stewie
line: Look! I'm making an angel!

name: Peter
line: See, Lois? Everything's gonna be fine.

name: Stewie
line: Now, smile while I write my name in you.

name: Peter
line: Let go!

name: Peter
line: [Peter laughing]

name: Peter
line: [Peter screaming]

name: Meg
line: But, Mom, I've got to use the bathroom now!

name: Lois
line: I'm sorry, but your father gets incredibly filthy rolling around everywhere. (Peter is in the bathtub) (from outside) He just has to take his 12 baths a day.

name: Chris
line: I don't like Dad anymore! I invited some friends over to jump on him like a trampoline but his roll of fat sucked up Ryan's shoe! And his mom yelled at him when he got home! And he beat me up at school the next day! It's all here in this pamphlet.

name: Lois
line: Kids, we just have to learn to accept this. Like one of those stories on Dateline where a family member suffers a horrible accident and becomes a burden on everybody. Sure they pretend to be happy, but they're dead inside. They're dead. And that'll be our lives. Hmmm?

name: Peter
line: What a big, boneless jerk I am! I might have screwed up my life but there's no reason I got to keep screwing up theirs. Good-bye, cruel, bone-filled world!

name: Peter
line: [yelling]

name: Peter
line: Oh, so this is where all the waste and sewage winds up.

name: Director
line: Cut and print. That's a wrap. Great job, Peter. Coming to the wrap party tonight?

name: Peter
line: Gee, I don't know. I got a standup comedy class I'm taking at The Learning Annex. Actually, I won't be a standup comic, I'll be more like an amorphous-blob comic. I gotta write that one down!

name: Director
line: Nonsense! I'll have the studio send a flatbed for you! See you at 8:00!

name: Jones
line: Peter, there's something I've been wanting to say to you all evening.

name: Peter
line: What's that, Mrs. Catherine Zeta-Jones-Douglas?

name: Jones
line: I want to jump your non-bones.

name: Peter
line: Jeez! I can't believe I'm your type.

name: Jones
line: Well, as you can tell from my husband, I've got a thing for saggy, shapeless men.

name: Michael Douglas
line: I'm married to Catherine Zeta-Jones. Will you sleep with me?

name: Peter
line: Yeah, I'm gonna have to pass. But Louie Anderson's eating the decorative soaps in the bathroom. Why don't you try him?

name: Doctor
line: ': Excuse me. Aren't you Peter, the human stunt bag?

name: Peter
line: That all depends on who's asking.

name: Doctor
line: I'm a doctor, conducting an experimental procedure to give bones to a jellyfish. I'd like to try it on a human first. Interested?

name: Peter
line: I don't know.

name: Doctor
line: Interested?

name: Peter
line: Did you just say that?

name: Doctor
line: Yes.

name: Peter
line: I'll do it!

name: Doctor
line: Well, Peter, the operation was a complete success! What are you going to do now?

name: Peter
line: The whole reason I had the operation was so I could go back to my family. But it's been so long. What if they don't love me anymore?

name: Doctor
line: Peter, where do you think all those bones came from?

name: Lois
line: Surprise!

name: Peter
line: My God! You mean, it's your bones that are inside me?

name: Stewie
line: Well, mostly. We picked up a drifter to fill in the torso.

name: Lois
line: Well, like I always say, a family of freaks is better than no family at all!

name: Peter
line: Let's go home. You know what's really weird? This was covered by my HMO.

name: Title card
line: Supergriffins>

name: The Count
line: Six! Six bats! Seven! Seven bats!

name: Peter
line: Hey, is the Count a vampire?

name: Brian
line: What's that?

name: Peter
line: Well, he's got those big fangs. Have they ever shown him doing somebody in and then feeding on him?

name: Brian
line: You're asking if they've ever done a Sesame Street in which the Count kills somebody and then sucks their blood for sustenance.

name: Peter
line: Yeah.

name: Brian
line: No, they've never done that.

name: Lois
line: Everybody come quick! There's something in the yard!

name: Meg
line: It looks like the back of a tanker truck.

name: Peter
line: Wow! What do you think's inside?

name: Chris
line: Maybe it's candy!

name: Lois
line: Chris, no!

name: Peter
line: Lois, Lois, let him dream.

name: Meg
line: What is this stuff?

name: Brian
line: It's some kind of nuclear waste.

name: Stewie
line: Tell me, does anyone else feel a trifle queasy?

name: Stewie
line: What? Do I have a boogie? I say, it appears my cranium has doubled in size! How delightful! This toxic stew seems to have given me telekinetic abilities.

name: Chris
line: Hey, I can make fire!

name: Peter
line: Chris, come here a second. This is gonna be hilarious. Okay, on the count of three. One, two, three.

name: Stewie
line: Do it again!

name: Lois
line: All right, everyone. Clearly, something very strange has happened here. We each seem to have acquired superpowers from that nuclear waste. We've been given a gift. And whether that gift is Chris' fire conjuring, Stewie's telekinesis, Brian's super-speed...

name: Brian
line: Ask how the Queen of England is.

name: Lois
line: How's the Queen...

name: Brian
line: She's great.

name: Lois
line: Peter's morphing ability...

name: Peter
line: Hey, Lois, I'm a wishing troll.

name: Lois
line: ...my super strength, or Meg's super-amazing ability to grow her fingernails...

name: Meg
line: [Sighs]

name: Lois
line: ...we have a responsibility to use these powers properly and not to abuse them for personal gain. Understand?

name: Brian
line: Yes.

name: Chris
line: Yep.

name: Meg
line: Yes.

name: Peter
line: Got it.

name: Lois
line: Oh, no. I forgot the detergent. Excuse me, would you watch him for a moment?

name: Clerk
line: Sure thing, ma'am. Whoa there, little guy. You got to pay for that.

name: Stewie
line: Go suck a railroad spike. I haven't got any money.

name: Clerk
line: Well, then I am afraid I am gonna have to take it away from you. [Screaming] Oh, God! Please help me!

name: Lois
line: Move it, you slowpoke! The light's green!

name: Man
line: What does that cloud look like to you, honey? To me it looks like rain! Ha! I used that joke at work. I'm the funniest guy at the office. They say I should do standup.

name: Lois
line: This is insane!

name: Meg
line: Oh, my God, Dad! *NSYNC is in town. If you can get me a lock of Justin's hair I'll never ask you for shopping money again. Please?

name: Peter
line: We promised Lois we'd use our powers responsibly. But I suppose doing the exact opposite couldn't hurt.

name: Peter
line: All right, Meg, wait here. I'll be right back.

name: Peter
line: Hi there. Britney Spears. You mind if I go in?

name: Security Guard
line: Not at all, Miss Spears.

name: Peter
line: Call me Peter. Hey there, fellas.

name: Justin Timberlake
line: Britney? What are you doing here?

name: Peter
line: Oh, you know, I was just in the neighborhood-I'm gonna steal one of your beers-and figured I'd stop by and say hi. You mind if I have a seat?

name: Peter
line: I am out of shape. Say, Justin, I got a favor to ask you.

name: Justin Timberlake
line: What is it?

name: Peter
line: I got a hole in my muffler and I need something to plug it with.

name: Peter
line: Can I have some of your hair?

name: Justin Timberlake
line: Um, I guess so.

name: Peter
line: Great. Thanks. All right, hold still now. You'll be fine. Hey, come here. Give me a kiss. [transforms into Gene Shalit] I'm Gene Shalit now! Bye!

name: Bartender
line: Here's your martini, ma'am.

name: Woman
line: Thanks. Hey, it's gone!

name: Bartender
line: Oh, I'm sorry, ma'am. Here's another one.

name: Woman
line: What the hell is going on here?

name: Brian
line: Hi. Can I get some pretzels or something? I got to drive. Did you bring enough breasts for the rest of the class? Ha-ha-ha!

name: Chris
line: Hey, Hector, how long have we known each other?

name: Hector
line: Since first grade.

name: Chris
line: Yeah, yeah. You remember that time you called me "Chris Gristle"?

name: Hector
line: I think so.

name: Chris
line: Well, burn for it!

name: Hector
line: [Screaming]

name: Tom Tucker
line: It's a bird, it's a plane, it's a lower-middle-class Irish family.

name: Diane Simmons
line: That's right, Tom. This is one of many public disturbances caused by the Griffin family of Quahog who seem to have acquired superpowers.

name: Tom Tucker
line: Very strange story, Diane. Coming up next, can bees think? A new study confirms that, no, they cannot.

name: Mayor West
line: Citizens of Quahog, we have a problem!

name: Justin Timberlake
line: You're damn right we do! Peter Griffin stole my hair!

name: Mayor West
line: Settle down, Jeffrey!

name: Justin Timberlake
line: Justin.

name: Mayor West
line: Mike. Clearly, the Griffin family is out of control. But not to fear. I've tangled with super-beings before. And they can be stopped!

name: Peter
line: You can't stop us, Mayor West! We are all-powerful!

name: Mayor West
line: Clearly, you've let yourselves become drunk with power.

name: Stewie
line: Silence!

name: Chris
line: We demand obedience!

name: Meg
line: Or else!

name: Man
line: Is that all you can do? [Meg scrapes him with nails] That kind of hurt! Is that bleeding? I guess it's all right. Ouch, though.

name: Peter
line: Anyone who opposes our demands will be destroyed. Our first demand: you will erect a statue in the town square. This statue will depict Blair Warner admitting to Mrs. Garrett that the poem she submitted for her creative-writing class was actually plagiarized from a work by Emily Dickinson. We have spoken!

name: Mayor West
line: That's it! We have to fight fire with fire. If nuclear refuse gave them superpowers, it could do the same for me. Citizens, I'm off to the toxic waste dump!

name: Hartman
line: Mayor West, you have lymphoma.

name: Mayor West
line: Oh, my!

name: Hartman
line: Probably from rolling around in that toxic waste.

name: Mayor West
line: I see.

name: Hartman
line: What in God's name were you trying to prove?

name: Mayor West
line: I was trying to gain superpowers.

name: Hartman
line: Well, that's just silly.

name: Mayor West
line: Silly, yes. Idiotic, yes.

name: Peter
line: No, no! That's not what Mrs. Garrett's bosom looked like. It looked more like this. [Peter transforms himself into Mrs' Garrett's cleavage] Notice the sun spots at the top of the right can.

name: Woman
line: Excuse me. I have a message from the Quahog Hospital.

name: Peter
line: I just feel awful about this, Mayor West.

name: Lois
line: Yeah. Me, too. Stewie, fluff his pillows.

name: Chris
line: I'll heat up his soup.

name: Brian
line: And I'll go to China to see if there's a cure. [leaves and returns with one of those conical straw hats] Nope.

name: Mayor West
line: Now, now. The doctor says I'm gonna make a full recovery. The important thing is, you learned your lesson.

name: Lois
line: I can't believe we let those superpowers go to our heads.

name: Stewie
line: I feel like such a bastard.

name: Brian
line: Me, too.

name: Peter
line: For now, we are gonna use our powers to help you get better.

name: Mayor West
line: Thank you. But as long as I have Mrs. Garrett's giant rack by my bedside, I'll be all right.

name: Peter
line: Girls! Girls! Girls! [Laughing]

name: Title card
line: Li'l Griffins>

name: Peter
line: Hear ye, hear ye. I call to order the first meeting of the We Hate Broads Club.

name: ALL
line: Yeah!

name: Brian
line: Because all you need in life is your best pals.

name: Quagmire
line: Sure! As long as those pals ain't dames!

name: Cleveland
line: O-tay!

name: Peter
line: What was that?

name: Quagmire
line: Hey, I thought we told you guys to quit snooping around here!

name: Tom Tucker
line: We need to find a story if I'm ever gonna be a big-time reporter, man.

name: Peter
line: All right, all right. Make like Siamese twins and split...and then one of you die.

name: Mayor West
line: When do we have the grape juice? I came for the grape juice.

name: Peter
line: Hey, Quagmire, watch this.

name: Teacher
line: Hey, "kick me"!

name: Teacher
line: Boys and girls, we have a new student joining us this morning. Her name is Lois Pewterschmidt.

name: Peter
line: Just what we need, another girl.

name: Quagmire
line: You said it!

name: Peter
line: Wow, I'd like to play doctor with her and remove her inflamed appendix before it bursts, causing sepsis.

name: Quagmire
line: Gigidy-gigidy-gigidy! [Alfalfa-style cowlick straightens out]

name: Peter
line: Hey, Lois, what you reading?

name: Lois
line: 'The Red Badge of Courage.' I sure wish I could meet a brave fellow like the guy in this book.

name: Peter
line: I'm a brave guy, Lois.

name: Quagmire
line: Oh, yeah? I bet you're not brave enough to laugh at Death!

name: Peter
line: Watch me. Ha-ha-ha!

name: Death
line: Oh, thanks! Like I don't have enough trouble fitting in!

name: Peter
line: I bet you're not brave enough to take all your clothes off!

name: Quagmire
line: Way ahead of you. Oh!

name: Peter
line: Well, I bet you're too chicken to spend a night at the old Selberg place.

name: Peter
line: Uh, Cleveland, you mind stepping out of the way?

name: Cleveland
line: Oh, sorry.

name: Quagmire
line: Well, I ain't chicken to spend the night there!

name: Peter
line: Well, I ain't neither! And to prove it, I'm going up there tonight!

name: Quagmire
line: See you there, pal!

name: Mort Goldman
line: You can't stay in that house! Old Man Selberg's ghost still haunts it. Not to mention the myriad of bacteria and allergens from years of substandard housekeeping. It does not augur well for you.

name: Peter
line: Aw, Zip it, egghead. You with your big words and your small, difficult words.

name: Lois
line: Wow. Any boy who would spend the night in that creepy place sure would be the bravest fellow I ever met.

name: Peter
line: That Lois is some kind of woman. Quagmire: Yeah. Just thinking about her makes my testicles want to drop. Oops! Speak of the devil. Oop, make that devils.

name: Joe
line: All right. Quagmire's team will take the left side of the house. Peter's team will take the right. And whoever's alive in the morning can bury his dead pals.

name: Cleveland
line: Do I have a cobweb in my hair? It feels like I have a cobweb in my hair.

name: Cleveland
line: What was that?

name: Quagmire
line: It's just Michael Winslow from Police Academy.

name: Michael Winslow
line: [Growling] [Monkey noise] [Helicopter noise] [Elephant noise] [Baaing like a sheep] [Submarine noise]

name: Joe
line: This house gives me the creeps.

name: Brian
line: Yeah. Let's get out of here.

name: Peter
line: Wait, wait, wait. We can't let those guys win. What we ought to do is pretend we're ghosts, see-

name: Quagmire
line: -and then we'll scare the other guys out of the house-

name: Peter
line: -then we can say that we spent-

name: Quagmire
line: -the-

name: Peter
line: -night. Then, everyone will think we're-

name: Quagmire
line: -the-

name: Peter
line: -bravest kids in the world. Especially Lois.

name: Quagmire
line: All right!

name: Peter
line: Hey, I got a great idea! <gets into suit of armor> This'll really scare them. Everybody set?

name: Joe
line: Check!

name: Brian
line: Check!

name: Goldie Hawn
line: Sock it to me!

name: Mayor West
line: If we only had a teacup, this'd be like playing Find the Teacup in the Bed Sheet, like I do with my Aunt Sophia.

name: Peter
line: My God! Not only are ghosts real, but their innards are made of children.

name: Quagmire
line: Peter, it's us!

name: Peter
line: Say, that's a nice effect.

name: Quagmire
line: Yeah. That's really scary.

name: Peter
line: Wait a second. If you're there, and I'm here and Istanbul is somewhere in this general area then who the hell is that?

name: Tom Tucker
line: Ha-Get used to this sight, Diane. Guys running away from you.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Tom, you're so deep in the closet, you're finding Christmas presents.

name: Peter
line: All right. Now, remember our story. We tell Lois that we both stayed all night. I caught the ghost with my lasso.

name: Quagmire
line: And I punched him so hard, he ran crying all the way back to Hell!

name: Peter
line: She'll have to believe that. It hangs together so perfectly.

name: Diane Simmons
line: Our top story today, cowardly kids lay down rubber at the old Selberg place.

name: Peter
line: Wait. Turn that up.

name: Tom Tucker
line: Peter Griffin and Glen Quagmire were seen bolting <gets louder> were seen bolting out of the supposedly haunted house after just one half-hour leaving only their pride and twin trails of urine behind them.

name: Quagmire
line: Cheese and crackers! Now Lois'll know everything!

name: Peter
line: Not if I can help it!

name: Tom Tucker
line: Newsroom.

name: Peter
line: Hello. This is Peter Griffin. You'd better stop saying that stuff or we'll watch something else!

name: Girl
line: <in Barbara Walters-like voice> Today on The View, cooties, the silent killer.

name: Peter
line: Lois? There's something we got to tell you.

name: Quagmire
line: Yeah. We didn't stay in the haunted house. We're not brave.

name: Lois
line: Oh, I've decided I don't care about bravery.

name: Peter and Quagmire
line: You don't?

name: Lois
line: No. I realized what I really like is smarts.

name: Mort Goldman
line: Sorry I'm late, darling. I was checking my stool for blood.

name: Peter and Quagmire
line: Mort Goldman!

name: Lois
line: He's so clever! Show them, Morty!

name: Peter
line: He got us again!

name: Quagmire
line: This whole thing just shows that women are nothing but trouble!

name: Peter
line: You said it! Let's you and me swear off them for good!

name: Quagmire
line: And how!

name: Peter
line: I say, Quagmire, it seems to me we've each made another $500 million.

name: Quagmire
line: Good thing we swore off women so we wouldn't be distracted and unable to accumulate this vast amount of wealth.

name: Peter
line: Yes. You watch the ticker. I'm gonna microwave a bagel and have sex with it.

name: Quagmire
line: Butter's in the fridge!

name: Which actually brings me to my next point
line: -Your wife's cheating on you.

name: Joe
line: Oh, my God!

name: Peter
line: Joe, I am so sorry.

name: Quagmire
line: Damn it!

name: Cleveland
line: This is ridiculous. Why did y'all drag me here?

name: Cleveland
line: Well, I suppose I could give it a try. (Walks over to a woman standing by the bar.) Hey, baby. How'd you like to go black and then have to make a difficult decision regarding whether or not to go back?

name: Woman
line: Sorry, I went burnt sienna and never went back. (A burnt sierra crayon comes up.)

name: Crayon
line: Ready, baby? Who's this clown?

name: Lois
line: Good morning, Chris. Oh, my God. Look at the size of that pimple! You're like a circus freak! ( laughs ) I'm kidding. You're just becoming a man, sweetie.

name: Peter
line: Yeah, I remember when I became a man.

name: Doctor
line: The operation was a success. What are you going to go by now?

name: Peter
line: Peter.

name: Chris
line: But I don't want to get rid of my zit. I like him. He's my friend. His name is Doug.

name: Brian
line: I just wish I didn't have to look at it.

name: Chris
line: Well, we have to look at your anus all day.

name: Stewie
line: Thank you!

name: Meg
line: Oh, my God! The Bachelorette is coming to Quahog! That's, like, my favorite show ever!

name: Brian
line: Meg, how can you watch that crap? That show's not reality. It's all staged. It's a complete mockery of human relationships.

name: Chris
line: You're a good pimple, Doug.

name: Doug
line: Feed me!

name: Chris
line: ( gasps ) You... talk!

name: Doug
line: That's right. And we're gonna raise some hell. All right! Raise some hell!

name: Cleveland
line: Peter, I can't do this. I'm too nervous. I gotta go.

name: Peter
line: No, no, Cleveland, I'm not going to let you do this. I'll tie you down if I have to.

name: Cleveland
line: Peter, this is only making it worse. Oh, God, my claustrophobia is setting in!

name: Peter
line: It's all right, it's all right, it's okay. It's all right. It's the fabric. It's the fabric. It's your clothes. All right, let's get your clothes off.

name: Cleveland
line: Peter! Peter, what's wrong with you? I'm naked.

name: Peter
line: Oh, God, you're self-conscious. I'm sorry. Here, you know what? Look, look. Cleveland. Look. See? See? Now you're not alone. You're not alone, Cleveland.

name: Cleveland
line: Let me out of here! I need to get out of here!

name: Peter
line: Cleveland, no. No, you're staying. This, this for your own good. This is for your own good.

name: Brian
line: Hi. Yeah, listen, I just wanted to apologize for Peter. He was just trying to help out his friend. You see, his wife left him and he's been kind of lonely, confused about what he really wants.

name: Brian
line: Brian.

name: Brian
line: They are stupid, but I figure I got a few days of free booze and free food before they kick me off. I could use a vacation.

name: Stewie
line: Oh, yes, 'cause you've got such a heavy workload around here. Hmm, how you, uh... how you coming on that novel you working on? Hmm? Got a big, uh, big stack of papers there? Got a, got a, got a nice little story you working on there? Your big -big novel you've been working on for three years? ( voice rising in pitch ) Hmm? Got a, got a compelling protagonist, eh? Got a, got an obstacle for him to overcome? Huh? Got a story brewing there? Working on... Working on that for quite some time, huh? Yeah, talking about that three years ago. You've been working on that the whole time? Nice little, uh, narrative-- beginning, middle and end? Some friends become enemies, some enemies become friends? Eh? At the end your main character is richer ( voice still higher in pitch ) for the experience, yeah? Yeah? Yeah, you've got, uh-- no, no. You deserve some time off. I'm super-excited. You think she'll be hot? I bet she'll be hot. I think she'll be hot, too!

name: Lois
line: Peter, I 'm getting a little worried about Chris. All he does lately is sit alone in his room talking to that zit.

name: Peter
line: Oh, relax, Lois. What's a zit going to do? Talk to him and tell him to sneak out of the house and cause trouble?

name: Doug
line: Now light it, ring the doorbell, and run like hell!

name: Chris
line: I don't know about this, Doug.

name: Doug
line: Just do it! ( doorbell rings )

name: Joe
line: Oh, good Lord! Is that. .. Doody!

name: Bonnie
line: I'm doing the dishes, Joe. I'll change you in a minute.

name: Trevor
line: I wasn't too nervous. I mean, when I'm nervous I work out and I wasn't working out, so I must not have been nervous. I was... I was very pleased and surprised.

name: Brian
line: I really was not expecting an open bar. Top shelf booze, I tell you. And this guy knew his stuff. Made me a mojito. I don't think it's a gay drink. Mo-ji-to.

name: Quagmire
line: ( breathlessly ) Giggity... giggity... giggity. ..

name: Quagmire
line: Giggity... giggity... giggity. .. (sighing)

name: Trevor
line: Dude, put your pants on.

name: Quagmire
line: shut up! Well, I really like all the guys, but some of them seem Sa little too competitive. I uh, I gotta tell ya, I don't know what she would possibly see in Count Chocula. I-I thin k he's just here because he's a minority.

name: Chris
line: You were right, Doug! Mischief is fun! We're the best pals since the Snorks.

name: Brooke
line: Brian.

name: Brian
line: What? Are you serious?

name: Brooke
line: I feel like I didn't get to know you at all. Would you accept this rose?

name: Brian
line: ( sighing) All right, but I think this whole thing is about as pointless as Peter's cow kite.

name: Stewie
line: Ooh, that means this room is mine now. Man, I'm going to party my ass off in here.

name: Stewie
line: Yeah, I got it from our cleaning lady's boyfriend. It's okay, though, 'cause she's gonna use the money to get a mammogram.

name: Lois
line: Chris! Where have you been?

name: Chris
line: Doug told me I don't need to listen to you.

name: Lois
line: Doug? Your pimple? Oh, that is it! First thing tomorrow we're going down to Goldman's pharmacy and get some astringent to get rid of that thing.

name: Doug
line: What did I tell you? She's trying to drive us apart. We can't let that happen. I am in no mood!

name: Brian
line: Oh, come on. You can' t expect me to ride that thing.

name: Brian
line: Brooke? What are you doing here?

name: Brooke
line: Ooh, I just can't take it anymore. All these guys just coming on to me. I had to sneak off. Oh, could I bum one of those?

name: Brian
line: You know , I don't even know why I agreed to do this show. This is just so not me. I would much rather just be home, listening to my old jazz records.

name: Brooke
line: Really? You know , I actually have quite a jazz collection myself.

name: Brian
line: Who do you like?

name: Brooke
line: DJ Jazzy Jeff.

name: Brian
line: Oh.

name: Brooke
line: I'm kidding. ( laughing )

name: Brian
line: Oh! You got me. You got me, yeah.

name: Brooke
line: No, I really like Coleman Hawkins, Ben Webster... ooh, and early Coltrane, before he got clean.

name: Brian
line: Yeah, yeah, no junk, no soul.

name: Brooke
line: No kidding. I mean, look at Chevy Chase.

name: Brian
line: Right, right. You know , I gotta say, I thought she was just some actress looking for her 15 minutes of fame, but she's, uh... she's pretty sharp, you know? I guess you can't judge a Brooke by her cover. ( chuckling ) You can... you can cut that out, right? Oh, and maybe you can cut when I said "junk" earlier, the whole Chevy Chase thing. Seems like he's probably the kind of guy who might sue. I mean, the guy's gotta have no money left.

name: Lois
line: Oh, my God. Peter, d o you think Chris might have done this?

name: Peter
line: Come on, Lois, he doesn't have the wild streak you had when you were younger. For God' s sake, you used to make plaster molds of celebrity body parts.

name: Lois
line: Okay, Daryl, it's almost dry. Very nice, by the way. This one 's going on the shelf right next to Dan Fogelberg.
Hey, Lois. Am I up next?

name: Lois
line: Just wait in your dressing room. I'll come back for you, Oates. ( door closes ) I'm not coming back for Oates.

name: Brooke
line: Glenn, will you accept this rose?

name: Quagmire
line: Really? After I drugged you and tried to have sex with your unconscious body?

name: Brooke
line: What?

name: Quagmire
line: Yes.

name: Peter
